loans.name: Mirzoyokub

texts.ru: Мирзоёкуб житель города Исфара. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он десять лет как занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном Мирзоёкуб занимается торговлей мужской одежды и обуви. Он берет кредит для покупки сезонной обуви.
texts.en: Mirzoyokub is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 32 years old, married and has two children.  He has been involved in sales at a market for ten years.  Mirzoyokub primarily sells men's clothing and shoes.  He is requesting this loan to buy seasonal shoes.

loans.use: to buy seasonal shoes

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She owns the land that she tills to grow rice. Carmelita sells her harvest at her town's market. She is able to help buy her family's basic needs with her income from farming.

Carmelita is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs. She is hoping to have a stable income and be able to help send her nephews and nieces to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 43 years old and a single mother. She has one child and has been running her poultry business and selling for a period of about seven years with an income of approximately KES 32,000. 

This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more chicks to raise and then sell. She hopes to give her child a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru: Мамурчон проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он рядом с домом открыл продуктовый магазин. Торговлей Мамурчон занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота, покупки необходимых продуктов.
texts.en: Mamurjon lives in the Vakhsh district.  He is 35 years old, married and has three children.  He opened a food market near his house.  Mamurjon has been involved in sales for three years.  He is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover by buying necessary products.

loans.use: to buy necessary products

loans.name: Validjon

texts.ru: Валиджон житель района Вахш. Ему 35 лет. Он занимается животноводством. В основном он откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Validjon is a resident of the Vakhsh district.  He is 35 years old.  He is involved in animal husbandry.  Validjon primarily fattens up and sells cattle.  he has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Bisaboat

texts.ru: Бисабоат мать 3 детей. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2008 года. Она с матерью торговали на остановке напитки, жвачки, сигареты. Сейчас ее мать по болезни не выходит торговать и Бисабоат решила взять ее лавку в свои руки, и продолжить бизнес. В этом году она планирует женить сына, свадьба требует больших затрат. Благодаря Арванд она, она хочет расширить свой бизнес и от прибыли откладывать на свадьбу.
texts.en: Bisaboat is a mother of three children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2008.  She and her mother used to sells beverages, gum and cigarettes at a rest stop.  Currently, her mother does not work due to an illness, and Bisaboat decided to take the stall in her own hands and continue the business.  This year she plans to marry off her son, and a wedding calls for a lot of expenses.  Thanks to Arvand, she wants to expand her business and save for the wedding from the profit.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia Doris alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hospedaje ella cuenta con este negocio el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,la socia lleva ya buen tiempo en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamete con su esposo,la socia es una persona empeñosa y responsable siendo de esta manera que  ella saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicia el prestamo para la compra de sabanas y colchas para su hospedaje.

La socia se siente feliz por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos establecidos.
texts.en:
Doris alternates her daily activities with the business of her inn. She depends on this business, which brings her both economic and personal satisfaction. So far she has done well with the business, which she runs together with her husband. Doris is a hard-working and responsible person, which is how she's gotten her family ahead. 

Doris is requesting a loan to buy sheets and bedspreads for the inn. 

She feels fortunate to be granted a loan and promises to make her established payments.

loans.use: to buy sheets and bedspreads for her inn.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a 39-year-old single woman with three children ranging from six to 20 years old. For the past 15 years, she has operated a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as kale, banana, and tomatoes. Veronicah describes herself as dedicated to her work. Her store is located in a busy estate and her customers are residents of the estate. Veronicah's greatest business challenge is the high price of fruits and vegetables. 

Veronicah is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy cereals as she has a passion to begin selling cereals in addition to her current offerings. She hopes this will increase her income. Her dream and business goal is to be a supplier and wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a farmer and grows vegetables, rice grains and corn grits to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. Josefina is married with three children. She is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Josefina has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer for her farm.  In the future, Josefina hopes to expand her farm and grow more crops to make more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Bertha Ines

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer soltera de 54 años que tiene un niño de 9 años a cargo y juntos viven en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del Ecuador. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada en el 2007. La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Bertha se dedica a vender ropa y cosméticos  de puerta en puerta desde hace dos años para poder subsistir. Su jornada promedio es de 6 horas al día, lo que le permite compartir tiempo con su pequeño hijo. Ella desea un crédito para capital de trabajo, con el cual podrá comprar mercadería (ropa y cosméticos) y así tener un mayor surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes y con ello mayores ventas y mejores ingresos. Además quiere ampliar su cartera de clientes. Con esto ella quiere tener un mejor calidad de vida y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hijo.

Este es su primer crédito, nos comenta que la atención del oficial de crédito fue muy buena ya que es una persona amable. Su sueño es tener una casa bonita y bien arreglada, un local donde pueda vender sus productos y una mejor vida para ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Bertha is a single woman, 54 years old, with a 9 year old child in her care and together they live in Santo Domingo which is one of the youngest cities in the country, and currently has become the focal point between the Sierra region and the coast of Ecuador. It is a special place, not only because of the rich ethnicity, but also for the landscapes that can be found from the entrance to this beautiful city.

Santo Domingo de los Colorados now belongs to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recently formed in 2007. The main festival of Santo Domingo is celebrated by a great number of visitors, commercial and cultural exchanges. A big fair takes place on the premises of the Cattlemen’s Association. There they show and compete the best examples of the breeds and crossbreeds which have been raised on the farms in the region.

Bertha has been selling clothing and cosmetics from door to door for two years in order to get by. Her average workday is 6 hours a day, and this permits her to spend time with her little boy. She is asking for a loan for working capital with which she will buy merchandise (clothes and cosmetics) and thus have a better selection to offer her customers and thus higher sales and better income. Also she wants to expand her customer base. With that she hopes to have a better quality of life and to cover the basic needs of her child.

This is her first loan. She says that the loan officer was very good to her and  a very kind person. Her dream is to have a pretty and organized house, a place where she can sell her products and a better life for her and her son.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 54 years old, married and has six children. She is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline has been raising pigs for 18 years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Evangeline requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Evangeline would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
This is Roselle, 35, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Sabino, a welder, and mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her variety store. Roselle works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.                             

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, where Roselle retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Roselle earns a profit by buying wholesale supplies and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. Roselle earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

Roselle is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory and continue operating her store. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Roselle hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products for her business

loans.name: María Reina De La Paz   (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal María Reina de la Paz está formado por 14 socias y 2 socios, quienes se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles, trabajadoras, que luchan día a día para poder aportar a la economía de sus hogares y así brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que es de clima frió, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta ciudad mantiene su belleza natural y cultural. Su gente es de un corazón cálido y mantienen la Cultura y Tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosaura, tiene 52 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, tres de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, un hijo estudia en la Universidad, otro en el colegio y su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios como guardia de seguridad privado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha su tiempo libre para dedicarse a la venta ambulante de de ropa y cosméticos, este negocio lo desempeña hace 3 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando ropa y cosméticos para continuar con el negocio y seguir creciendo.
 
Su meta es comprarse un terreno.

Las fotos pequeñas son de tres socias y un socio que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The community bank, María Reina de la Paz, is made up of 14 female and 2 male partners, all of whom are kind, genuine and hardworking. All of these members struggle on a daily basis to support and provide a better future for their families. They all live in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate. Since December of 1999, Cuenca has been a recognized by the UN as a city with great Cultural Heritage of Humanity, and it has maintained its natural and cultural beauty. The people of Cuenca are kind hearted, and continue in the traditions and culture of their ancestors.

One of the group members is Rosaura, who is 52 years old and is married with eight children. Two of her children are married and live with their families, while three of her children are employed and contribute to their family’s economic situation. One of her sons is studying at a university, another is in high school, and her youngest son attends a public school in Cuenca. Her husband works as a private security guard, and contracts out his services. They live in their own house.

Rosaura completes the chores around the house, and uses her free time to travel around the area selling clothing and cosmetics. She began working in sales three years ago, and works seven days a week without a fixed schedule.

This is her third loan through the community bank, and with the support from this new loan, she plans to purchase clothing and cosmetics so that she can continue her business. She hopes to continue growing that business, and her goal is to eventually buy land.

The small photos of the three women and one man are of the group members who were absent when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has run her business for five years and also earns income from selling food and firewood. Cayetana has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

Cayetana is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing equipment and spare parts for her business. In the future, she dreams of expanding and building her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and spare parts

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 58 years old and is married to Jactone. The couple has been blessed with six children. For the past 12 years, Miriam has owned and operated a beauty salon in Nakuru town. 

Miriam is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD to buy blow dryers, hair combs, and chemicals to use in her salon. Her loan will enable her to better serve her customers and increase her income. In the future, Miriam hopes to expand her business and better equip it to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy blow dryers, hair combs, and chemicals

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and married with three children. For the past 11 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from an eatery. Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid 16 previous NWTF loans and this will be her second Kiva loan. 

Lourdes is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell

loans.name: Jose Ramos

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 36 años de edad, es casado y vive en casa propia junto con su esposa. Vive en el centro poblado Hacienda Vieja, en el distrito de Túcume. Cuenta con los servicios básicos, y su centro poblado cuenta con aproximadamente 60 familias.
La actividad a la que se dedica José es la venta de animales, así como también se dedica a la agricultura.
El monto del crédito es de 2400 nuevos soles, los cuales los utilizará para comprar más animales para vender, como son chivos y conejos, compra de alimentos para estos y arreglos y remodelación de su corral.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old, married, and lives with his wife in their own home. He lives in the town center of Hacienda Vieja, in the Túcume district. They have access to basic amenities, and their small town is made of up approximately 60 families. 

José makes a living selling animals, and also works in agriculture.

The loan amount of 2400 nuevos soles will help José to purchase more animals for resale, such as goats and rabbits. This support will also help him to buy animal feed and work on repairs for his corrals.

loans.use: to purchase animals and grow his business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 59 years old and widowed. For the past 10 years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from pig fattening. Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans with NWTF and has previously been funded by Kiva. 

Leonora is requesting a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other items in her store. In the future, she aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and married to Evaline. Together they have two children. For the past 14 years, he has been selling vegetables in a Nakuru retail market. Peter also sells to traders, hotels, and other buyers. 

Peter is requesting his first loan to buy cabbages and other vegetables to have enough stock to meet the high demand of his customers. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and supply vegetables to other towns to increase his income and provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy cabbages and other vegetables

loans.name: Budbaatar

texts.en: Budbaatar is a 37-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children in a ger in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife operates a clothing sales business and he runs a taxi service around the area where they live. Sometimes he does construction work. He has been running his business for three years. The business has become successful in the area and it is appreciated by the local people. Budbaatar is a responsible man who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by purchasing construction materials in large quantities." The total amount he is requesting now is 2,000,000 tugriks to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia, 51, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, her business partner, and is the mother of three children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Celia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Celia hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 48 years old and is married with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. Marites  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  

Marites is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, bath soap, beverages, snacks, and canned goods

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one working child. With the support of his son, Toufic  has become capable of fulfilling his family's demands. Since 1992, Toufic has owned a glass shop where he also sells mirrors and other related types of glass. 

Toufic is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added glass supplies for his business. He notes that this will develop his work and provide him with a higher income. In the future, Toufic plans to open other branches in surrounding areas.

loans.use: to purchase glass supplies for his business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married with seven children. She is 51 years old and lives in Liposong, Ozamis City, Philippines. Teresita manages coconut production to earn a living. She has been managing their farm for 10 years and earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. 

Teresita requested a loan of 6,313 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. She has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2008. Teresita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Mme Maty, âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de famille est une dame qui s’active dans le commerce depuis 4 ans. Elle vend de la friperie et du parfum de classe et s’approvisionne dans la capitale. Elle n’a jamais eu de crédit à l’IMCEC et demande l’appui de ce dernier pour honorer une commande de draps de friperie. Elle va aussi acheter du parfum et  de la crème pour le corps. Maty n’a pas de charge et les bénéfices de son activité sont reversés dans son capital afin de diversifier les produits et services dans le but de maximiser son profit pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Maty, age 34, is married and has a family.  She has been actively involved in retail business for the past four years.  She sells used clothing and nice perfumes and buys her goods in the capital city.

Maty has never received a loan from UIMCEC before, and she is now requesting financial assistance from this microfinance institution in order to pay for an order of used bedsheets.  With her loan, she will also be buying some perfume and body lotion.

Maty has no expenses, and the profits from her activity are re-invested into her capital in order to diversify her products and services.  Her goal is to maximize her profits in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Ernestina;la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa de artesania, ella se encarga de la venta de la mercadería, la socia trabaja durante el dia, la socia a la vez elabora aretes,pulseras y collares que tambien lo vende de forma independiente a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como alambre para la elaboracion de aretes. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the community bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo", which is located in the Ollantaytambo district in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Ernestina balances her daily activities with working at a craft business.  She is responsible for selling the merchandise.  She works during the day, and also makes earrings, bracelets, and necklaces that she sells independently to customers who order them.  She is a responsible and hard-working person who wants to get ahead for her family.

She is asking for this loan to purchase materials, such as wire to make earrings.

Ernestina is thankful and values the loan granted.  She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wire to make earrings.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Borrower Otgonbayar is a 41-year-old married woman who has one daughter. She lives with her family in an outer ger district of the city of Ulaanbaatar in Mongolia. She's been supporting her family for 8 years by selling door locks at the largest indoor market of Mongolia. Therefore, she is very experienced in this kind of business. Also, she is a very trusted and repeat client of Transcapital Company Ltd. In 2004, she requested her first loan. Now she is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian tugrik loan to purchase a variety of door locks, since weather for construction is starting.

loans.use: to purchase door locks  to sell

loans.name: Ziyaratou

texts.fr:
Ziyaratou est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un pilote. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 9 ans et le dernier a 3 ans.
Ziyaratou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des articles de mercerie pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Ziyaratou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de mercerie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ziyaratou voudrait développer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ziyaratou is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a pilot and has three children, ages 3 to 9.  Two of her children attend school.

Ziyaratou has been working as a reseller since 2004.  She sells dress-making supplies from home, to a wide range of customers.  She buys her goods in Lomé and works alone.  At the moment, her major challenge is that she cannot meet all of her customers' demand.

Ziyaratou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy dress-making supplies.  She wants to reinvest in her activity.  In the coming years, she would like to expand her business.  She says that with the profits, she is planning to take care of her children's educational needs.

loans.use: to buy dress-making supplies.

loans.name: Luz Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, por la parroquia del Valle lugar que tiene encantadores paisajes naturales, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, muchas laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca ejerciendo varios cargos, son de un corazón cálido y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Luz tiene 47 años, es casada y su esposo labora fabricando cielos rasos, con el trabajo conyugal han realizado su casa propia.

Doña Luz nos comenta que se encuentra en un tratamiento por una infección pero su familia se encuentra muy bien en la salud. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de estucos (cielos rasos), labora conjuntamente con su esposo iniciándose en este trabajo ya que su esposo sabia del arte, llevan 8 años en el negocio y les va bien, pero hay dificultades ya que hay muchas veces que el materia se encuentra escaso y eso no les permite culminar sus obras a tiempo.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de yeso, carrizo y otros materiales, en el pago de su crédito anterior no tuvo ninguna dificultad en cancelar a la fecha. El banco comunal le gusta por el compañerismo y los créditos les permiten solventar los gastos de su negocio para seguir creciendo.

Su meta es engrandar su taller.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Corazón de María community bank, which is located in the parrish of Valle, an area known for its beautiful landscapes.  The people work raising animals, as farmers, and in business.  Many work in the city of Cuenca doing various jobs.  They have warm hearts and maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Luz is 47 years old, married, and her husband works constructing ceilings.  Working together, they have their own home.  

Luz tells us that she is in treatment for an infection, but her family is very healthy.  She works making stucco ceilings along with her husband.  She started in this work since her husband knew the art.  They have had their business for eight years and it is going very well.  There are difficulties, including many times when they have few materials, since this does not allow them to finish their work on time.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of plaster, reeds, and other materials.  She had no problems meeting the deadline on her last loan.  She likes her community bank for the camaraderie, and the loans allow them to cover the costs of their business so they can continue growing.

Her goal is to increase the size of their workshop.

loans.use: to purchase plaster, reeds, and other materials.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por ser Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica, su clima es frió pero su gente de un corazón muy cálido, amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La. Señora María tiene 29 años, está separada pero en su unión conyugal ha procreado 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Vive con sus padres en una casa arrendada y comparten los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. María agradece a Dios ya que goza de muy buena salud al igual que toda su familia. Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a vender ropa de bebé, actividad que la desempeña hace 12 años iniciándose en el negocio gracias al ejemplo de sus padres y a que este negocio le da ganancias para salir en adelante.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa de bebé para tener una mayor variedad. En el pago de su crédito anterior no ha tenido dificultad realizando la cancelación de los pagos a la fecha. El banco comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que hay en el grupo y la rapidez en la entrega del crédito.
 
Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the communal bank, "Corazón de María."  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is recognized as being a United Nations World Heritage site.  Is is the third-most important economic city in Ecuador.  Its climate is cold but its people have very warm hearts.  They are friendly and kind and maintain the culture and tradition of their people.

María is 29 and is separated but she has 2 children from her marriage, who are 11 and 8.  Her son, her oldest child, is in secondary school, and her daughter, the youngest, is in elementary school.  She lives with her parents in a rented house, and they share the home's expenses.

María thanks God that she enjoys very good health and that her entire family does as well.  She does chores around the house and sells baby clothes, work that she has done for 12 years.  She started her business thanks to the example that her parents set, and it is giving her earnings to get ahead.

She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of baby clothes to have a larger variety.  She didn't have any trouble paying back her previous loan on time.  She likes her communal bank because of the camaradarie of the group and how quickly they can get a loan.

Her goal is to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes.

loans.name: Alfonso Ines

texts.es: Don Alfonso Ines, caballero de vision amplia, puesto que desde tiempos atrás a trabajado para alcanzar lo que hoy en dia posee con mucho sacrificio. Solo el hecho de ser pastor evangelico manifiesta sentirse muy afortunado y orgulloso ya que por la gracia de Dios y por su infinita misericordia a disfrututado de las mejores condiciones de vida que pueda tenerse en esta tierra. A futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para abrir una sucursal de su misma tienda de ropa en su tierra de origen donde el nacio, que se ubica en uno de los departamentos de nuestra capital Managua, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos personales que favorezcan la economía de su hogar, por ahora solicita un apoyo para invertir en su negocio de ropa y asi de esta forma realizar las siguientes compras: blusas, camisas, ropa para niños, zapatos, sandalias entre otros articulos que ayuden al crecimiento de su pequeña tienda. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y a su vez al de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Alfonso Ines is a gentleman with great foresight, since he has been working for a long time with many sacrifices to achieve what he has today.  Only being an evangelical pastor makes him feel very fortunate and proud since by the grace of God and by his infinite mercy has he been able to enjoy the best living conditions that he could have on this earth.  

In the future, he hopes to have the resources to open a branch of his same clothing store in the land where he was born, which is located in one of the departments of the capital of Managua.  This will allow him to improve his personal income which helps his household.  

Currently he is asking for this loan to invest in his clothing store and make the following purchases: blouses, shirts, children's clothing, shoes, sandals, and other items of clothing that will help him grow his small store.  

He is thankful to the institution for supporting the development of his store and at the same time, the development of his family.

loans.use: to purchase various items of clothing for his store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 46 years old and married to Paul. She's been a poultry farmer in Nakuru for the past 15 years. This involves rearing of chicks then, when grown, she sells them to different hotels and clients. She also supplies eggs to her clients. This is her first loan and she plans to use the loan to buy chicken feed. In the future, Jane hopes to expand her poultry business and supply chicken and eggs to other towns, hotels and schools. She wants to become one of the best poultry farmers in Nakuru town.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Marcy

texts.en:
Marcy is 42 years old and married with three children. Marcy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been running this business for 10 years now and also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. She requested a 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marcy has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia Aurelia continua dedicandose a la venta de frutas en uno los mercados de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, la socia ya lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual mediante este ella saca adelante a su familia,la socia trabaja durante el dia vendiendo su mercaderia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,la socia desea que su negocio cresca mas y de esta manera brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mas fruta para su negocio como platanos y manzanas.

La socia Aurelia se encuentra agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago establecido.
texts.en:
Aurelia continues to work selling fruit in one of the markets in the city of Ollantaytambo. She has already been in this business for a good amount of time. Thanks to her business she has helped her family get ahead. Aurelia works during the day selling her merchandise. She is a responsable and hard-working woman. She hopes to grow her business more and thus give her family a better quality of life.

Aurelia is requesting this loan to purchase more fruit for her business, such as bananas and apples.

Aurelia is grateful for the loan she has been granted and is committed to honoring the established payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit for her business, such as bananas and apples.

loans.name: Junna Liza

texts.en: Junna Liza is 32 years old and lives in Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. Junna Liza has a business selling "pastillas" (sugar coated milk candies), earning about PHP 4,000 monthly from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more pastillas to sell. Junna Liza has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more "pastillas" to sell

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en:
Yehya is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and five children, one of whom is studying while the others work. Yehya is responsible for fulfilling his family needs and paying his child’s study fees.

Yehya has been working in the agricultural field since 1990 and has the ambition to continue in this domain. He’s specialized in installing plastic tents and raising cattle. He is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional cattle for his farm and some plastic tents. In the future, Yehya plans to buy new land and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle and some plastic tents

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 63, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband, Danilo, is a driver. They manage their household while operating the business. Rosario works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosario operates a tailoring business, mainly offering curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other household accessories. Seasonal demands for clothing such as uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Rosario earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosario is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosario hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is married and works hard to support her family. For the past 13 years, she has operated a business buying and selling frozen products. Jessica has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en: Cesaria, 51 years old, is married and has 2 children. For the past 10 years, she has operated an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cesaria has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has already borrowed 11 loans from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Cesaria would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leoba Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leoba, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de  edad, el menor de ellos está soltero y aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es jubilado.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar en el hogar, instalo en su casa una sala de video juegos, allí también hace poco compro lo necesario para vender sodas, jugos y ciertos bocadillos de picar, ella abre su negocio a las 8h00 y cierra a las 18h00, allí trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo cuando él puede y está desocupado, lleva cinco años en su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para surtir su negocio para comprar sodas, energizantes, jugos, papas fritas, dulces y varios productos más. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es  tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
In the residential community Circunvalación in the city of Manta, the Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto meets every 15 days. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are highly visited in every season of the year by domestic and foreign tourists. It is also known for being one of the most important ports in the country and America, located on the shores of the Pacific.

This is where we met Señora Leoba. She is 51 years old, is married and from this relationship has 6 children who are all adults.  The youngest of them is single and still lives in her house. Her husband is retired.

She ia a very good homemaker. In order to obtain her own income, and with this help in the home, she installed a video game room in her house. Also there, not long ago, she bought what is necessary to sell soda, juice, and certain sandwiches for snacking. She opens her business at 8:00 am and closes at 6:00 pm. She works there with the help of her son when he can and he is not busy. She has worked in her business for five years and it is going well for her.

This loan is to supply her business, to buy sodas, energy drinks, juices, potato chips, candies and various other products.  This is the 6th cycle in the Banco Comunal and and she likes them because of the help that the loans bring.

Her dream is to have a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy sodas, energy drinks, juices, potato chips, candies, etc.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,ganadera y artesana.

Magaly se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral y ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo los puede ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y mejorar sus corrales, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más dinero para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Magaly es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Magaly is a twenty-two-year-old mother of a family. She lives with her husband and children in a house that she owns, though it lacks basic services. It is located in Tambogrande, a district in the Peruvian "departmento" of Piura. The region is characterized by by agricultural activity, ranching, and craft work. 

Magaly has made her living for several years by breeding and selling poultry and pigs. She has a corral in back of the house and she feeds them balanced diet, complete with natural grains. Once they reach their optimum growth, she is able to offer them to clients, and with the earnings she pays her family's expenses.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 PEN in order to buy balanced feed for her animals and improve their corrals. Once the animals fatten, she sells them at different markets in the region with the object of getting the best price for them. This way she is able to have more money and a better quality of life. Magaly is a hardworking and very responsible person, and the only thing she wants is for her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for feed and miscellanous improvements for her poultry and pig business.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Khady est une ancienne cliente de l’IMCEC ; elle fait parti des cinquante 1er clientes de ce guichet. Au temps ou l’Institution n’avait qu’un statut de microcrédit, on vendait  les carnets dans les quartiers, Khady faisait parti de celles qui faisaient la promotion de la mutuelle. En ce temps, elle travaillait comme » travailleur social » par intérim ; mais s’activait déjà petit à petit dans le petit commerce. Elle a eu à bénéficier de plusieurs crédits. Dix ans s’est écoulé et la voila qui a agrandi son commerce. Actuellement, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des tissus d’été (meulfeu), des parfums...
Khady est mariée, et la dépense quotidienne est prise en charge par son époux. Elle travaille pour son propre confort et celui de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Khady is a previous client of the microfinance institution IMCEC; she is one of the first fifty clients of this branch office. When the institution had only one microloan statute, booklets were sold in the districts. Khady was a part of those who promoted the  "mutuelle" [revolving savings and loan association]. During that time, she worked as a social worker in the interim. But she was already active in small-scale commerce a little at a time. 

She had to obtain several loans. Tens years passed by, and now you can see her business has grown as a result. Currently, she is requesting a loan for buying some summer fabrics (meulfeu), some perfumes….

Khady is married, and her husband covers the day-to-day expenses. She works for her own sake and her children's.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to resell and also some perfume

loans.name: Estelito

texts.en: Estelito is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has no children. For the past 5 years, Estelito has operated a vulcanizing shop, repairing tires, flat wheels and some junk bicycles and motorcycles. He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy tools (t-wrench, screw driver, air compressor) and to pay for electricity. Estelito has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more tools for the shop

loans.name: Noé Elias

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.

En este lugar vive el Señor Noé, tiene 63 años de edad, está divorciado  pero de ese compromiso tiene dos hijos ya todos son mayores de edad e independientes.
 
Él es contador público  titulado y trabaja de profesor en una  universidad de la localidad, pero además de esto también se dedica al comercio pues tiene un negocio en sociedad con una de sus hijos, ellos tienen un centro de cómputo en el centro de la ciudad este centro también es librería y papelería, en este negocio también se realizan trabajos contables, asesorías y proyectos, además del servicio de internet, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, su hija trabaja todo el dia en el local y él en sus ratos libres. Llevan más de 5 años con este negocio y les deja muy buenos ingresos.

Este crédito es para invertir en útiles escolares ya que pronto empieza la época de clases y se vende mucho de estos productos en esta temporada. Para él este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir nuevos créditos.
  
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the residential community Circunvalación in the city of Manta, the Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto meets every 15 days. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are highly visited in every season of the year by domestic and foreign tourists. It is also known for being one of the most important ports in the country and America, located on the shores of the Pacific.

This is where Señor Noé lives. He is 63 years old and is divorced, but from this commitment he has 2 children. Now they are adults and independent.
 
He is a certified public accountant and works as a professor in a university in his town. But besides this, he also works in trade. He has a business in society with one of his children. They have a computer center in the center of the city. This center is also a bookstore and stationery store. In this business they also carry out accounting work, consulting and projects, besides internet service.  They work every day from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm. His daughter works all day on location, and he does in his free time.  They have been doing this business for more than 5 years and it brings them very good income.

This loan is to invest in educational tools, now that the season of classes starts soon and many of these products are sold in this season.  For him, this is his 4th cycle in the Banco Comunal and he likes it because of the ease with which one can obtain new loans.

His goals are to grow his business and move forward.

loans.use: to buy educational tools.

loans.name: Ndeye Astou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ndeye Astou est âgée  de 31 ans. Elle est célibataire et évolue dans le stylisme depuis pus de 10 ans. Parallèlement  elle est employée comme agent commerciale dans une boutique d’un quartier de la localité. Elle a choisi le stylisme 	par passion et le commerce pour subvenir à ses besoins sociaux. La confection de jolis boubous l’intéresse beaucoup mais aussi la réalisation de bénéfices. Elle est membre  d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un montant de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de quelques  habit s qu’elle va revendre. Elle veut ainsi renforcer son stock d’habillement pour mieux développer son activité. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux prendre en charge ses  propres  besoins.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Astou is 31 years old and unmarried. She has been working in fashion design for over ten years. Concurrently, she is employed as a sales rep in a district store in her town. She chose fashion design out of passion; she chose  business to support herself. Making beautiful "boubous" (long, flowing outfits) is very interesting to her, as well as making a profit. 

She has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since August 2011. She is requesting the amount of 50,000 francs for buying some clothing she will resell. Thus she wants to bolster her stock of clothing to develop her business further. Her goal is to increase her profits in order to do better supporting herself.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Lizeth María

texts.es:
Lizeth María es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es una joven que se gana el pan de cada día impartiendo clases a niños de primer grado en una comarca aledaña a dicho municipio donde tiene varios años de dedicarse a este oficio.
Cabe señalar que tiene muchos deseos de superación, de brindarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar y de prepararlos como profesionales y personas de bien que aprendan a valerse por sí solos en el futuro.
Es por tal motivo que visitó ceprodel con la esperanza que le otorgaran su primer crédito para mejorar las condiciones de un dormitorio con el cual comprará pintura, cemento y pago de mano de obra, por lo que confía en Dios que le aprueben tal solicitud para cumplir su objetivo y espera una larga relación con esta Institución a la cual no piensa quedarle mal.
texts.en:
Lizbeth María is originally from the municipality of El Sauce. She is a young woman who brings home the daily bread by giving classes to children in 1st grade in a neighboring region to the above-mentioned municipality. She has spent several years working in this trade.

It is worth mentioning that she has a lot of desire to overcome, to provide her children better living conditions in her home and to prepare them as professionals and good people that learn to take care of themselves in the future.

It is for this motive that she visited Ceprodel with the hope that they grant her first loan, to better the conditions of a bedroom, with which she will buy paint and cement and pay the workers. For this she trusts in God that they approve her request to carry out her objective and she hopes for a long relationship with this institution, which she doesn't wish to disappoint.

loans.use: to buy paint, cement and pay workers.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 52 years of age and lives in Manguiles, Mahayag, Zamboanga del sur. She is married with four (4) siblings and has a general store. She has been doing this business for 2 years.

Lourdes has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 2 years. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Lourdes hopes that someday she could earn a lot with her business and help her family through the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Shimika Group

texts.fr:
Philippe fait partie du groupe Shimika et habite à Ruyigi.Il a 40 ans et est marié à  Leocadie, cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants, dont 4 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, bière, haricot,…) depuis  14 ans.

Il est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital en multipliant  des  articles, lors de l’achat des produits de sa boutique, pour gagner plus, au moment de la revente.
texts.en:
Philippe is part of the group Shimika. He lives in Ruyigi. He is 40 years old and married to Leocadie, a farmer. Together they have seven children, of whom four are in school. 

Philippe has been a storekeeper (rice, beer, beans, …) for fourteen years.

He is on his eighth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital by expanding his offerings of goods he will buy for his store and earning more upon selling them.

loans.use: to expand his offerings in his store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 48 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. El domicilio propio está ubicado en el Caserío La Pala, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural, pero cuenta con luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Gloria es la preparación y venta de chicha y piqueos, así como la venta de cerveza. Atendiendo en propio domicilio los días sábados, domingos y lunes. Cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona. Su conviviente es agricultor y ganadero, con parcela propia y cabezas de ganado vacuno.
El monto del préstamo es de 800 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán en la compra de cerveza al por mayor, para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a forty-eight-year-old woman. She has a common-law marriage and has two children in her care. Her house is located in the small town of La Pala in the Tambogrande district. She lives in a rural area, though she does have electric light.

The business Gloria is developing is the preparation and sale of food and maize liquor, as well as the sale of beer. Her she works out of her own home on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays. She has an established clientele in the area. Her husband is a farmer and rancher with his own parcel of land and heads of cattle.

The sum of the loan is 800 PEN, which she will use to purchase beer wholesale to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy beer for her restaurant.

loans.name: Stalla

texts.en: Stalla lives together with the husband and 3 children in Mpohor.  Stalla operate a grocery shop.  This she has done for some  years now.   The items in her grocery are different kinds of soft drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, tin milk and others.  Stalla uses her income to assist the husband to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: restock her grocery store

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is a 51-year-old married man living with his wife and seven children, three of them are working. Despite his big responsibilities, he was able to open his own business after being involved in the same field for many years. He started his own business as a farmer in 1992 and is looking forward to expanding.  Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase chemical products, seeds and more farming supplies. This loan will boost his productivity and therefore his revenue, thus his way of living.  In the future, he plans to open his own fruits and vegetables shop.

loans.use: buy chemical products, seeds and farming supplies

loans.name: Serigne

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne est âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de 7 ans.  Il exerce l’activité de pêcheur  depuis plus de quinze ans. Etant  issu de parents  pêcheurs, Il a choisi son activité par amour. Il est très content quand il prend beaucoup de poissons et ceci   lui procure des revenus importants. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour la fabrication d’une nouvelle pirogue qu’il va confier à un de ses parents,  ce qui va lui générer des revenus supplémentaires. Par conséquent ce financement voire l’accroissement de ses revenus lui permettra de  mieux prendre en charge les dépenses liés  aux besoins de sa famille et aussi a veiller a l’amélioration des conditions sociales de cette dernière.
texts.en:
Mr. Serigne is 37 years old, married, and a father of a 7-year-old child. He has been a fisherman for over fifteen years. Being the child of a family of fisherfolk, he chose this work for the love of it. He is very happy when he catches a lot of fish, which brings in important revenues. 

He has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since April 2010. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for building a new boat that he is going to entrust to one of his relatives. This will generate extra revenues for him. 

Consequently, this financing, not to mention an increase in revenues, will enable him to do better in covering expenses related to family needs and also to take care of improving his family's social conditions.

loans.use: to building a second boat

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 54, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Abelito, a carpenter, and is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Evangeline operates a laundry shop. She handles the operation and promotion. They offer the washing of clothes and other garments, also folding and pressing them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, Evangeline is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies like detergent, fabric softener and other materials they use in the business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Evangeline dreams to open new branches and hopes to get to more customers in the market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy supplies for her laundry business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Liezel has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years.  Liezel requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, snacks & beverages.

Liezel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar lives in Agsu, Azerbaijan. He is married and has one school-aged son. He owns a a vegetable stand in a busy market which has many clients. 

Vuqar applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase additional stocks of vegetables. His challenge in business is a lack of adequate capital. Vuqar hopes this loan will improve the livelihood of his family. This is his first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Imelda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Imelda requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergents, shampoo, bath soap, cereals & beverages.  Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and married with one child.  Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more additional stocks to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns additional income from her food vending business.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she can provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s the one responsible for his family, that’s why he works under pressure and he’s more than happy to do that.  

Mahmoud has owned an aluminum factory for fifteen years. Today, he’s looking to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new aluminum equipment for his work in order to improve his business and attract added customers. In the future, he plans to take bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: buy aluminum equipment

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is married with 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. She sells beef and frozen chicken at Mbem near Abura, which she has done for 8 years now.

Afua uses her income to support her husband and feed and clothe their children. Afua will use her loan to purchase beef and chicken to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beef and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Paul Ivan

texts.es:
Paul es un hombre de 28 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos . Vive en casa de sus padres, y su madre firma como aval este crédito. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Platillos, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la zona rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad a la que se dedica Paul es a la crianza de ganado ovino y caprino, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Complementariamente es trabajador estable en una parcela agrícola en la cual le pagan mensualmente. Su madre se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, de esta manera los dos contribuyen en los gastos del hogar.
El monto del crédito es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán empleados para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor.
texts.en: Paul is 28 years old, single and doesn't have children. He lives in his parents' home, and his mother signed off as a guarantor for this loan. Their home is located in hamlet of Platillos, district of Tambogrande. It is in a rural area of the district, but the house still has electric services. Paul makes a living raising sheep and goats, which he sells at the local market once they reach ideal size and weight. Additionally, he pays for a small parcel of farm land monthly. His mother makes a living selling clothes and beauty products, and in this way they both contribute to the household finances. He plans to use the loan to purchase balanced feed for his small livestock.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 38 years old and is a single mother of five children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.  This is her second loan in KADET LTD.  She repaid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting on her farm.  She hopes to start selling fruits in near future to boost her business.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).

Ruth has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Ruth sells her products at  the market by means of wholesale.  She also generates additional income through selling bananas.

Ruth has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Ruth include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to see her three children through university. 

Ruth lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fish vendor.  She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them for sale.  Ama has been selling smoked fish for 8 years now. She is married and has 8 dependents.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general up keep of their family. Ama will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale.  Ama will expand her business with the new profit

loans.use: buy fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 59-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. They are both working. They all cooperate together to enrich their life and live properly. 

Nahida started her own home business as a tailor in 2000. Today, she needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added materials, such as textiles, in addition to a new tailoring machine. She’s sure that this loan will boost her productivity and therefore her sales and revenue.  In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop and hire someone to work with her.

loans.use: to purchase added materials, such as textiles, in addition to a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 38 years old and married to Jedidah. Together they have three children. He is a timber seller and has been in the business for the past 1 year.

This is Samson's second term loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase timber for resale.

He hopes to purchase a truck to aid him in transportation.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 57 years old, married to Esther and together they have two children.  He has been a farmer in Nyahururu town for the last 22 years.  He plants maize and other crops which are usually in high demand and this has been very profitable.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy spare parts for his tractor and thereby be able to plough his farm in preparation for this planting season.

In the future, Robert hopes to expand his farming and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: buy parts for his tractor

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is a 57-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. He's the one responsible for covering their needs, even though they’re both united and cooperative. 

Elene started to work as a tailor from her home in 2003 after many years of experience in this domain. In parallel, she works as a tailor at one of the local companies.  As for her husband, he owns a curtains shop. 

Today, Elene is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new sewing machine. This Kiva loan will facilitate her work and allow her to attract new customers. In the future, she plans to open her own evening dresses shop.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is 26 years old and lives in, Labo, Ozamiz City. She is married and has one school-age child.

Leslie has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Leslie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has  2 children. 

Virgie has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, detergents, shampoo, snacks & beverages.

Virgie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Virgie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old and is married with 2 children. To make a living, Amalia plants and  harvests bananas to sell. She has been doing this business for 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Amalia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,580 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Yoqub

texts.ru: Ёкуб-мужчина средних лет,по специальности строитель,подрабатывает на своей специальности частными работами. По выходным дням выходит на скотные рынки в районы. Закупает скот и продает их на местных рынках,откармливая их несколько дней.Помощники в откорме скота являются сыновья и жена Каромат. Ёкуб кредитуется у нас уже много лет, и за весь период кредитования он всегда использовал кредит на животноводство и получал хорошую прибыль от своего дела,улучшил  свои условия и благодарен нам за поддержку. Он привел в нашу организацию многих своих знакомых и намерен с нами работать в будущем.
texts.en: Yoqub is a middle-aged man who is a construction worker by trade and works in his specialty as a contractor. On free days he goes to his area's livestock markets. He buys livestock and then sells the animals at local markets after feeding them for a few days. His son and wife Karomat help him care for the animals. Yoqub has done financing with us for many years and for the whole period he has always used the loans for raising livestock, and earned a good profit off of his work. He improved his situation and is grateful for the support. He introduced many of his acquaintances to us, and plans to work with us in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 30 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has 3 children. 

Roland has a fruit vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional varieties of fruits to sell.
 
Roland has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Roland hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Gororoka Group

texts.fr:
Julienne fait partie du groupe Gororoka  et habite à Kibimba, commune sous la direction de la branche de Gitega. Elle a 37 ans et est mariée à Joseph, un enseignant. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de 10 ans à 18 ans. Deux enfants étudient à l’école secondaire, les deux autres à l’école primaire.

Elle est  commerçante de bananes et de pomme de terre depuis 10 ans.

Elle est à son onzième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  bananes et de la pomme de terre à revendre, pour gagner plus. Elle va aussi  acheter une chèvre.

Les gains tirés du commerce, lui permettent de nourrir la famille, habiller les enfants et payer leurs frais  scolaires.
texts.en:
Julienne is part of the group Gororoka. She lives in Kibimba, a commune under the direction of the Gitega branch. She is 37 years old and married to Joseph, a teacher. Together they have five children, from 10 to 18 years old. Two of the children are in secondary school, and two others are in primary school. 

Julienne has been a merchant of bananas and potatoes for ten years. 

She is on her eleventh loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital by buying a large amount of bananas and potatoes to resell in order to earn more. She is also going to buy a goat. 

The profits from the business will enable her to feed her family, provide clothing for the children, and cover their schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of bananas and potatoes to resell, and also to buy a goat.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in a small village of Sagarejo District, East Georgia. He is 44 years old, married, and lives with his family: wife Lia and two sons (13 and 9 years old). His children go to school. George works with the local security police as a security officer. Along with his main job, George is actively involved in the family's agricultural business. In particular, they grow wheat and maize on a family-owned plot of land, which are sold at the local open market to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

George requested credit for renting a tractor for tilling the land, as well as purchasing fertilizers. After tilling and fertilizing, George will sow maize and wheat. George and Lia will work hard on the plot during spring and summer in order to get a good harvest in late summer. They will sell harvested products through the known channels and get a planned profit, which will be used for further development of the family's agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and  rent a tractor.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Arlyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, detergents & beverages.

Arlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Erla

texts.en: Erla is married and has 2 children.  She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Erla operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for 2 years and every month she earns PHP 2,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,500 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.   In 2010, Erla joined GDMPC. In the future, Erla hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: repair a vehicle for her transport business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and is a married woman with 7 children aged between 3 and 19 years. Her husband works as a fisherman and a barangay councilor.

Marilyn helps her husband manage their fishing business. She requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and floats. This will help them bring in more fish and increase their profits. Marilyn hopes for their income to improve that would help send all their children to school.
