loans.use: buy fishing nets, lead weights and floats

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, only child and one relative. He’s the main source of income for his family. 

Youssef started his own business as an electrician in 1977. His work consists of setting and installing home electricity. He works upon request on a free-lance basis. Today, he asks for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew and buy added electrical tools for his new project. This will definitely boost his work and thus his profits. In the future, he plans to better develop his business and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: buy electrical tools

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is married and has 8 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Consuelo owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year.  Each month, she earns PHP 3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of  PHP 14,900 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Consuelo has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Consuelo hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her general store

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia has been a farmer for 7 years. She owns a piece of land in San Miguel, Bohol, that she cultivates to grow rice crops. Olympia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes to have an abundant harvest.

Olympia works hard for her family of a husband and 10 children. Five of her children are school-aged. Olympia hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He’s doing the best he can to support his family and offer them a fair way of living. He has been working as a car painter since 1988 and has his own garage. He also transports students with his own van. 

Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van. In that way, he will be able to transport his students safely without facing problems. In the future, he plans to enlarge his garage where he can serve more clients and buy a bigger van.

loans.use: service his van

loans.name: Alvie

texts.en:
Alvie is 33 years old and lives in P-3 Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married and has one child.

Alvie has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month. She has a requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Alvie has been a member of PMPC for 5 months. In the future, Alvie hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio y sumado a su arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante.
Gracias a la ayuda que recibió de Kiva y de fundación ha podido seguir creciendo y poder darle así una mejor atención a sus clientes. También le está yendo muy bien en su otro negocio de venta de artesanías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, y demás insumos que necesita para poder seguir abasteciendo su negocio y ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Angela is a very hard worker and thanks to her effort and sacrifice in addition to her hard work, she has been able to get ahead.

Thanks to the help she received from Kiva and the foundation, she has been able to continue to grow and provide better care to her customers. She is also doing very well in her other business selling crafts.

Angela is requesting a loan for the purchase of food, beverages, dairy, and other inventory.  She needs to continue to supply her business and offer a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy food, beverages, dairy, and other inventory.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar is a 41-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Hentii province, Mongolia. His wife has a sewing job. The children study at the local secondary schools. 

Boldbaatar started a welding business based on his experience. He previously worked for a mining company for 7 years. Therefore, his welding service became popular in the area and he makes the various types of welding both at home and at the customers' places.  He has few equipment and machineries for the business. 

Boldbaatar is a hardworking man who says that "I would like to expand the business activities by purchasing cold welding machine and materials. I am planning to offer more services to the customers". The total amount he is requesting is 1,250,000 MNT to buy welding materials and a sewing machine for his wife's business.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine and welding materials

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 3 children. 

Romeo has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo & beverages.

Romeo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Hajarah

texts.en:
Hajarah  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Hajarah has a business selling cattle. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Hajarah sells her products at the market by means of wholesale. She also generates additional income through a motorcycle for hire.

Hajarah has requested for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cattle for resale. The main business challenges for Hajarah include seasonality and increased transport costs.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to build rental rooms. 

Hajarah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 60 years old, married and has 2 children.  Felicidad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.


Felicidad requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan.   Felicidad aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Ma. Dulce

texts.en:
Ma. Dulce is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 10 years.  Ma. Dulce also earns more income from buying and selling frozen foods.  She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of assorted clothes to sell for her clothes selling business.

Ma. Dulce has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Binvineda

texts.en:
Binvineda is 59 years old, married, and has 4 children -- 2 children are in school.

Binvineda is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines.  She has been raising livestock for 20 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  Binvineda requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and an additional cow to raise.

In the future, Binvineda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy livestock vitamins and a cow

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. With one child in school, Linda works very hard to provide for her family.

Linda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar, and other miscellaneous goods. 

In the future, Linda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
Pompia is a 62-year-old entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She owns and manages a sari-sari store business located at her town's public market. Pompia sells items like sugar, eggs, canned goods, toiletries and spices. She earns 10000 PHP per month with her business.

Pompia is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, softdrinks and pig feeds. Pompia plans to use any extra profit to pay for her 15-year-old child's school expenses.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, 47, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joefil, a driver, and is a mother of her child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her child’s studies. 

Merlinda operates a market stall. She sells vegetables and other cooking items in the community market. She buys quantities of vegetable products and other common items used in cooking and sells them per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Merlinda is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetable products and condiment items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlinda dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 43 years old, married and has 4 children. With 2 children in school, Salome works very hard to provide for them.

Salome runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar, and other miscellaneous goods.   She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Salome would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Mónica Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive por el sector de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por ser Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica, su clima es frió pero su gente de un corazón muy cálido, amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Mónica tiene 20 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos, su primer hijo tiene 3 años y 5 meses y su segundo hijo 2 meses de edad. Su esposo es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuestos de licuadoras, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su madre pero de manera independiente.

Ella por el momento no se encuentra trabajando y pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y realizando los quehaceres de su hogar. 

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en el negocio de su esposo, va a comprar repuestos para licuadoras.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the Corazón de María [Heart of Maria] community bank. She lives in the Yanaturo area of the city of Cuenca. The city is known as a [UNESCO] World Heritage Site and it's the third most important city economically. The climate is cold, but its people are warm-hearted, friendly, and kind, and continue the culture and traditions of the region. 

Mónica is 20 years old and lives in a common law marriage. She has two sons; the oldest is 3 years and 5 months, and the second is 2 months old. Her husband is a shopkeeper who sells spare parts for blenders. They don't have their own home, but live with her mother in an independent way. 

At the moment Mónica doesn't work; she stays home to care for her children and do housework. 

This will be her second loan with the community bank, and she will invest it in her husband's business to buy spare parts for blenders. 

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for blenders.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, en el Caserío Muy Finca Punto Nueve, que se encuentra a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.
La actividad que realiza Juan  es la crianza y comercialización de animales, los cuales son criados en corrales en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Cría pelegueyes, chanchos, aves de corral, etc., los cuales son animales que negocia quincenalmente. Adicionalmente Juan se dedica a la agricultura y al jornal. Tiene sembrado arroz en terreno ubicado cerca a su domicilio.
El monto del crédito es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán en la compra de alimento para sus animales y en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de arroz.
texts.en:
Juan is a forty-six-year-old man. He is married and has three dependent children. He lives in his own house, in the hamlet Muy Finca Punto Nueve, which is forty minutes outside of the city of Lambayeque.

Juan's business is breeding and selling animals, which he raises in corrals outside of his house. He raises sheep, pigs, poultry, etc., which he sells every two weeks. Additionally, Juan makes a daily wage by farming. He has planted rice in plots near his home.

The sum of the loan is 1500 PEN, which he will use to buy feed for his animals and to buy manure and fertilizers for his crops of rice.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La Sra. Eva tiene 18 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora. Eva es madre soltera, tiene un hijo quien es su razón de vivir y por quien ella lucha incansablemente.
La señora Eva se dedica a la Venta de celulares y accesorios en un local que esta alquilando. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque solo ella trabaja en la familia y tiene que llevar para el pan de cada día. Su sueño es comprar para su propio local y así progresar cada día más. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carcasas, baterías y celulares nuevos con lo cual podrá seguir teniendo buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en: Eva is 18 years old and a very hard-working young woman. She is a single mother, and her son is her reason to live and tirelessly fight. Eva makes a living selling cell phones and accessories at a store she rents. She tells us that she sacrifices a lot for her work because she is the only one in her family who works and she has to bring home the daily bread. Her dream is to buy her own storefront and make progress every day. She is requesting the loan to purchase cases, batteries and new cell phones so she can keep having a good variety of products to offer her customers. She is grateful for you help because the loan will be very useful.

loans.use: to purchase cases, batteries and new cell phones to sell.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to repair her store and buy a variety of snack food to sell from her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her store and buy a variety of snack food to sell

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 44 years old. He lives in a small village in Sagarejo district with his family: wife – Lia and 15-year-old son who goes to school. 

The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have a milk cow. Lia produces and sells on average 15 kg of cheese on the local open market per month. Along with the abovementioned, Vazha has a horse. He takes wood from the forest to the village with his horse.  The wood is sold in the village among the local population. They consume it for heating their houses. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris. 

Vazha requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With two milk cows, Lia will be able to produce and sell double the amount of cheese. It will significantly increase the income for the family. Vazha plans to use the increased income for the renovation of the family's house, which is already old, to improve the living conditions for his family members.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Elma has a small boat that is used for catching fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools for the maintenance of her small boat, for buying fishing nets and also to buy additional varieties of fish to sell, like dalagang, bukid, tilapya, milk fish, flying fish and tamban.

Elma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: repair her fishing boat and buy fish to resell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old and married with 10 children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.  

Delia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Delia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a home products retail business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.

Lorena requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more home products to sell.  In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy home products to resell

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Adjovi est une femme âgée de 33ans. 
Adjovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle vend des liqueurs et divers autres articles pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Adjovi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et des liqueurs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjovi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Adjovi is a 33-year-old woman. She has been working as a retailer since 2011. She sells liquor and a variety of other items to anyone in her shop. She purchases her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is an inventory shortage. 
 
Adjovi has requested her first loan with WAGES in order to buy some grocery items and liquor. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the next few years, Adjovi would like to expand her business. With the profits, she says she plans on supporting herself.

loans.use: to buy liquor and various other goods

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Khai is a 56-year-old married woman. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working as a truck driver. Khai supports her family by running a food stall that serves breakfast to the people in her local community. 

Khai would like to use her loan to buy more furniture and dishes to better serve her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and expand her business. 

Khai hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions and set aside some saving for facing difficulty in the future.

loans.use: to buy furniture and dishes for her stall

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from hog raising.
 
Nelly requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell and feeds for her pigs.  In the future, Nelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her general store and buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada y con 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande, y cuenta con los servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de ropa, perfumes y productos de regalo, tiene un pequeño bazar en su propio domicilio en el cual atiende permanentemente y también entrega productos a clientes y luego cobra a quincena o fin de mes. Su esposo es agricultor y mototaxista, tiene parcela propia y mototaxi propio.
El monto del crédito es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán utilizados en la compra de mercadería para comercio, tal como ropa, perfumes y productos de regalo, para surtir el bazar que tiene en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a forty-five-year-old woman, married and with three children in her care. She lives in a house that she owns in the urban area of the Tambogrande district. She has basic services.

The business she is developing is the sale of clothing, perfumes, and gift items. She has a small bazar in her home where she offers permanent service. She also delivers products to clients and then charges every fortnight or at the end of the month. Her husband is a farmer and taxi driver. He has his own parcel of land and his own taxi.

The sum of the loan is 1000 PEN, which she will use to buy merchandise for her business such as clothing, perfumes, and gift items to stock the bazar that she has in her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de  pescado, se dedica a esto hace más de 5 años por lo que ya tiene buena experiencia en esto. 
Pablo tiene su propia embarcación, redes y equipos de pesca, lo que le ayuda a poder trabajar sin tener que depender de nadie. El se define como una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, con lo cual podrá tener más peces en stock, ya que tiene mucha demanda y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes. Pablo agradece la ayuda que esta recibiendo de kiva y de fundación pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en: Pablo is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling fish. He has been dedicated to this activity for more than five years, so he already has some good experience. Pablo has his own boat, nets and fishing equipment, which helps him work without depending on anyone. He is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help his family. He is requesting the loan to purchase fish, which he will use to have more fish in stock since demand is high and he wants to be able to satisfy his customers. Pablo is grateful for the help he is receiving from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguay because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy products in bulk to sell in her store

loans.name: Djiby Moussa Y

texts.fr: Djiby est un homme arié et père de trois enfants.Il exerce dans le commerce depuis près de dix ans. Il souffre depuis quelques années de myopie et est ainsi obligé d'utiliser des verres correcteurs. Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 100 000f pour acheter de nouvelles verres.
texts.en: Djiby is married man and the father of three children. He has had a business for nearly ten years. For several years, Djiby has been suffering from myopia and is therefore compelled to use corrective lenses. So he is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy new glasses.

loans.use: to buy new glasses

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 49 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo joven San Martín, en Lambayeque. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercialización de  plásticos, abarrotes y animales. 

La actividad a la que se dedica María es la venta de plásticos y aves de corral, contando con 6 años de experiencia para este negocio. Los dos negocios en su domicilio cuentan con clientela fija.

El préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles, será destinado a la compra de plásticos y alimentos para sus aves de corral.
texts.en:
Maria is a forty-nine-year-old woman. She is single and lives in a house that she owns, located in the young town of San Martín, in Lambayeque. The quality of life in the community is subsistence. The majority are independent workers employed in plastic, grocery, and animal sales businesses.

María makes her living by selling plastic and poultry. She has six years of experience in this business. Both businesses in her home have a fixed clientele.

She will use the loan of 2000 PEN to buy plastics as well as feed for her poultry.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Feliciano es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar por medio de su trabajo. Gracias a la ayuda que ha recibido, ha podido ir creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
El desea poder seguir abasteciendo su negocio, y es por ello que nuevamente acude a la fundación paraguaya y a kiva, ya que desea comprar Juego de aro, cadena, pistón, cilindro y otros, con lo que tendrá bien surtido su local.
texts.en:
Feliciano is a person with a great desire to get ahead and make progress through his work.  Thanks to the help he has received, he has been able to grow and improve his living conditions.  

He would like to continue to be able to stock his business, so he has again approached Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  He would like to purchase a set of rings, chain, piston, cylinder, etc. which he will use to have a well-stocked shop.

loans.use: to purchase a set of rings, chains, piston, cylinders, etc.

loans.name: Ratasida Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme AISSATA est la représentante du groupe RATASIDA II. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Le plus âgé a 25 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans. Parmi ses enfants deux (02) vont à l’école. Elle a cinq (05) personnes en charge.

	Mme est vendeuse de gâteaux pâtisserie depuis 05 ans.il s’approvisionne dans une boutique au secteur 17 de Ouagadougou. Elle livre ses gâteaux dans les boutiques.

	Mme veut s’acheter 02 sacs de farines de blé, 02 sacs de sucre,01 bidon d’huile et 01 foyer à gaz.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour faire face à ses échéances. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. AISSATA is the representative of the group RATASIDA II. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest child is 25 years old, and the youngest is 3. Two of the children go to school. She has five persons to support. 

Ms. AISSATA has been selling cakes for five years. She gets her supplies from a store in Sector 17 in Ouagadougou. She delivers her cakes to shops.  

She wants to buy 2 sacks of wheat flour, 2 sacks of sugar, a container of oil, and a gas oven.

Ms. AISSATA uses her profits to meet her loan payments. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of wheat flour, a container of oil, and a gas oven.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltero y vive con su madre. El se dedica hace más de un año a la compra y venta de carnes en su propia carnicería, donde ofrece una gran variedad de cortes de carnes de todo tipo. 
Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico debido a la gran cantidad de personas que se movilizan por esa zona. Tiene una clientela bien formada y su deseo es aumentarlo y por esa razón solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de carnes, con lo cual podrá tener bien surtido su negocio y darles gran variedad a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sergio is from the city of Santani. He is single and lives with his mother. For over a year he has worked buying and selling meat in his own butcher shop, where he offers a great variety of cuts of meats of all types.

His business is strategically located, due to the large number of people that pass through the area. He has a well-formed clientele. His wish is to increase it, which is why he asks for a loan to buy cuts of meat so that he can have his store be well-stocked and can give his customers a greater variety. He is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for this opportunity, because this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat to sell.

loans.name: Patinde 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est la représentante du groupe PATINDE II. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre(04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 26 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans. Parmi ses enfants quatre (04) vont à l’école. Elle a six (06) personnes en charge.

	Mme est restauratrice depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de pissy et Laafi-yaré. Ses clients sont ses amis et voisins.

	Mme  veut s’acheter 01 sac de riz, des légumes, une assiettée de sel, 20 litre d’huile et de la patte de tomate.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour épargner et aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir d’autres restaurants.
texts.en:
Ms. MARIAM is the representative of the group PATINDE II. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest child is 26 years old, and the youngest is 9. Four of the children go to school. She has six persons to support. 

Ms. MARIAM has been a restauranteur for fifteen years. She gets her supplies from the Pissy and Laafi-yaré market. Her customers are her friends and neighbors. 

She wants to buy a sack of rice, some vegetables, a plateful of salt, 20 liters of oil, and some tomato paste. 

Ms. MARIAM puts her profits toward savings and toward helping to cover her children's school fees. Her ambition is to open more restaurants.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, some vegetables, a plateful of salt, 20 liters of oil, and some tomato paste

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia Verónica alterna sus actividades diarias ejerciendo su carrera de profesora ella continua enseñando a niños pequeños en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco ,a la vez la socia tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,galletas,gaseosas entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable con muhas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,la socia desea poder agrandar su negocio y de esta manera brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como en la compra de golosinas.

La socia Verónica se compromete a pagar sus suotas en el tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
Veronica alternates her daily activities with her job working as a teacher.  She continues to teach small children in one of the schools in the city of Cusco.  At the same time, she also has a business, which consists of a store where she sells groceries.  She sells all types of products, including rice, sugar, milk, cookies, soft drinks and other products.  She is a responsible person who has a strong desire to continue working for her family.  She wants to be able to expand her business, and in this way provide a better quality of life for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business, such as, for example, snacks.

Veronica is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business, including snacks

loans.name: Book Khol  2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "BOK KHOL 2" se compose de cinq femmes qui pratiquent toutes le commerce.Elles sont mariées et mères de familles. Elles vendent des produits cosmétiques et des tissus.Les revensus tirés de leurs activités leur permettent de prendre en charge leurs propres besoins ainsi que ceux de leurs familles.Pour renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des parfums, des tissus et d'autres produits cosmétiques. Elles ambitionnent d'acheter des cantines au marché de leur localité.
texts.en:
The group "BOK KHOL 2" comprises five women who all work in commerce. They are married mothers with families. They sell cosmetics and fabrics. The profits derived from their businesses enable them to meet their own needs, as well as those of their families. 

To bolster their business funds, they are requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy perfumes, fabrics, and other cosmetics. Their ambition is to buy stalls at the market in their town.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, fabrics, and other cosmetic products

loans.name: Ronald Ysaac

texts.es:
Ronald es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, junto a el vive su esposa a la cual quiere mucho y que vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener playas hermosas, por su agricultura en especial el cultivo del arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del mundo y por su riquísimo Chupe de Camarones, asimismo por la generosidad de sus pobladores. En s tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio y también le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus paltos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos “frejoles”.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ronald se levanta cada día para abrir su tienda de venta de abarrotes en la cual trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, puede atender hasta 35 clientes y sobre todo él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Ronald está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar el pintado de su tienda, con lo cual se verá más limpia y también comprar mercadería para su negocio como Arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, bebidas gaseosas, entre otros, lo que le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguir luchando día a día para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño: “Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Ronald is a hardworking and enthusiastic young man. He lives with his beloved wife in the city of Camaná, which is known for beautiful beaches, agriculture (in particular the rice crop which is considered one of the best in the world), shrimp chowder, and also for the generosity of its people. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends and he also likes to eat one of his favorite foods, "frejoles" [beans].

With much excitement, Ronald gets up each day to open his grocery store where he works around 10 hours a day. He can serve up to 35 customers and he thinks his business is going well because he's very friendly and offers quality products at reasonable prices.

Ronald is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to paint his store so that it looks cleaner, and he will also buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, and other things that will allow him to offer his customers a greater variety of products and increase his income. He will keep fighting every day to achieve his biggest dream: "having a bigger business".

loans.use: to paint his store and buy merchandise.

loans.name: San José  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San José se encuentra está formado por ocho socias y un socio quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Santa Ana en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene grandes paisajes demostrándonos su belleza natural, desde el parque central se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales, comercio y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, se caracterizan por su hospitalidad, amabilidad y por mantener viva las costumbres y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Carmen, tiene 57 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, tres de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, su último hijo pasa en casa y ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar. Su esposo labora como jornalero realizando trabajos en la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María Carmen se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y a la agricultura, lo que produce es solo para el consumo de su hogar, también cría vacas, cerdos, borregos y gallinas a los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Pertenece al banco comunal desde hace 15 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
The village bank San Jose is made up of 8 women and one man who live near the parish of Santa Ana in the city of Cuenca. This place has a cool climate and huge countrysides that show off its natural beauty. From the central park you can see a large part of the city of Cuenca. The people work in farming, animal husbandry, commerce and other activities in the city. They are known for their hospitality, friendliness and for keeping their customs and traditions alive.

One of the members of this group is Maria Carmen, 57, who is married and has 4 children. Three of them are married and live on their own, while her youngest son lives at home and helps with the chores. Her husband is a farm laborer. They own their home.

Maria Carmen takes care of the housework and the farming, growing food only for their consumption at home. She also raises cows, pigs, sheep and hens which she sells when she needs to.

She has been part of the bank for 15 years and will invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens.

Her goal is to keep growing her animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Llinset Del Carmen

texts.es: Llinset es una señora con un gran deseo de superacion. Su objetivo principal se ha concentrado en realizarle mejoras a su hogar. Hoy en dia continua laborando para una distribuidora donde el giro principal de esta empresa es la venta de abarrotes,ocupando el cargo de responsable de venta. Agradece a Dios y a la institucion por brindale la ayuda economica que ha necesitado para hacer de esto un hecho real; ya que por motivo de la alza de los precios de materiales no ha podido terminar por completo todo lo que ella se ha propuesto. Siendo este su sexto ciclo de credito con el cual pretende invertirlo en la compra de los siguentes materiales de construccion: hierro, cemento, bloques, arena, laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos entre otros y asi llevar a cabo el plan de construir la division interna de su cuarto, mismo que le traera para su persona y familia mayor privacidad.
texts.en: Llinset is a woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  Her main objective has been to make improvements to her home.  She is still working for a grocery distributor as a salesperson.  She thanks God and Afodenic for providing the financial assistance she has needed to make this a reality.  Due to the increase in the cost of materials, she has not been able to complete everything that she has proposed.  This is her sixth loan cycle in which she plans to invest in the purchase of the following construction materials:  iron, cement, blocks, sand, zinc panels, purlins, hardware, etc. to move forward with the plan to construct internal rooms in her home.  This will provide her and her family with greater privacy.

loans.use: to construct internal rooms in her home.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre muy trabajador, vive junto a su esposa la cual es su mano derecha y con sus 2 hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo y trabaja día  a día para sacarlos adelante y sean mejores que el, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener playas hermosas, por su agricultura en especial el cultivo del arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del mundo y por su riquísimo Chupe de Camarones, asimismo por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Como buen peruano le gusta la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “lomo Saltado”.

Con mucho carisma y sobre todo esfuerzo Pedro trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 50 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismático y atento con sus clientes y sobre todo porque cada día agradece a Dios por permitirle llevar el pan a su hogar.

Pedro está muy agradecido con la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a ese gran apoyo el podrá comprar llantas nuevas para su vehículo ya que las que tienen ya están muy gastadas y también  para realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo
texts.en:
Pedro is a very hardworking man.  He lives with his wife, who is his right hand, and his 2 children, whom he loves very much.  He works every day for them to get ahead and be better than him.  His home is located in the city of Camana, a city that is known for its beautiful beaches, its agriculture, especially rice, which is among the best in the world, for its delicious "chupe de camarones" (shrimp chowder), as well as for the generosity of its residents.  Like all good Peruvians, he likes the traditional food of our country, and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious "lomo saltado" (a dish of stir fried beef, vegetables, and potatoes).

Pedro works as a taxi driver, with great charisma, and above all, effort.  He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 50 customers in a day.  He believes that his business is going well because he is very charismatic and attentive with his customers and because he thanks God every day for allowing him to support his family. 

Pedro is very thankful for the help that Kiva lenders have given him.  Thanks to this help he will be able to buy new tires for his vehicle, as the ones he has currently are very worn.  He also will do general maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase tires and perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania es socia del Bancomunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, ella es dueña de 3 buses y también tiene una chacra  donde siembra papa, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 13 años, ella esta muy agradecida por todo lo que le enseñaron con las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal,ella pudo progresar junto a su familia,comprar su casa, y ahora ella tiene 3 terrenos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para arreglar uno de sus unidades de transporte.
texts.en: Melania is a member of communal bank Las Entusiastas.  She is 48 years old and mother to 3 children.  She owns 3 buses and agricultural land where she grows potatoes.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 13 years.  She is very thankful for everything her communal bank has taught her.  With their training she has been able to make progress along with her family, purchase a house, and she now has three parcels of land.  She is requesting this loan to make repairs to one of her buses.

loans.use: to repair one of her vehicles.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Sharon has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 to buy stock of canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, snacks & beverages.
Sharon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Sharon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, snacks, cereal, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Dely

texts.en:
Dely is 52 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell.

Dely has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and food vending.

Dely aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Dénédi

texts.fr:
Dénédi est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants.
Dénédi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle vend des produits BB et des liqueurs dans son bar pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Dénédi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits BB et des liqueurs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dénédi voudrait agrandir son bar. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Dénédi is a 28-year-old woman.  She is single and has no children.

Dénédi has been working as a reseller since 2011.   She sells liqueurs and products from Brasserie BB (a local brewery in Lomé).  She has a bar, at home, and sells to a wide range of customers.  She buys her goods in Lomé and works alone.  At the moment, her main challenge is that she is out of stock.

Dénédi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy liqueurs and products from Brasserie BB.  She wants to reinvest in the activity.  In the coming years, she would like to increase the size of her bar.  She says that with the profits, she is planning to provide for her own needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as shampoos, toothpaste and snack foods, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her general store and purchase basic goods to stock the store.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha is requesting a new loan to buy rice to restock her store. Ha's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 58-year-old married woman with one son. Her husband works as an actor. Hoa lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa has run a business of selling coconuts for two years. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing coconuts at wholesale prices to sell to people in the local community. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy coconuts at wholesale prices to sell

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is requesting a new loan to buy beads, hair pins, and different products for selling. Anh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beads, hair pins, and different products for selling and to repair her store.

loans.name: Fayzulo

texts.ru: Файзулло житель города Фархор. Ему 59 лет. Он женат.  У него четверо детей. Он занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 18 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Fayzulo is a resident of the town of Farkhor. He is 59 years old, he is married and has four children. He does animal husbandry. He has been in this business for eighteen years. Fayzulo is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Agua Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Agua  esta conformado por nueve  siete mujeres trabajadoras y humildes con deseos de mejorar  de hacer crecer sus negocios  y su vida.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de pinotepa nacional Oaxaca tierra de gente trabajadora de progreso y también de hambre ya que hay muchas personas pobres pero también muchas personas tragadoras.
En pinotepa lo que mas se baila  son las chilenas  en pinotepa hay pequeños negocios y también  muchos niños jugando en el  parque y muchas señoras vendiendo tamales en las calles de la comunidad.
Una de las tradiciones de pinotepa es la fiesta de quinto viernes donde hay muchos juegos y diversión para los niños en las calles esta se puede observar la peregrinación  una obra de la vida de Jesé cristo, las personas salen ha ver a los jóvenes quienes interpretan la obra.
Para las personas esa fecha es de perdón y arrepentimiento y una fecha para vivir y perdonar a los demás.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo  es la señora Maria  Emiliana de cuarenta y nueve años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora trabajadora amable orgullosa de sus raíces y de su negocio.
Doña Emilia como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo se dedica a la venta de refrescos y tamales, vendiendo refrescos lleva vendiendo veinte años, y tamales veinte años.
Lo que mas le gusta de vender tamales es prepáralos ,Doña Emilia nos cuenta que  los tamales se preparan de la siguiente manera primeramente poner las hojas de plátano a calentar , y las limpia, después prepara el chile al chile le echa una  media cebolla, también le ella chile puña y chile gaguillo, ajo, después los muele lava la carne de pollo, pone la carne junto con el junto con el chile ya preparado en una bandeja grande , prepara la masa echándole manteca , para tortear la masa pone la hoja y encima le pone un poco de masa y la hace en forma de tortilla y le echa el chile y el pollo junto dobla la hoja en forma de Tamale ya que este todo junto lo pone a la  lumbre , espera que se cosan los saca de la olla y va avisar que tiene tamales para que vayan sus clientas a comprarle.
Doña  Emiliana  tiene  seis  hijos Maria de Jesús, Moisés, Eleazar, Francisco, Angelo y Juan José ellos son su motor para seguir adelante los quiere mucho y desea que siempre cuenten con ella.
Doña Emiliana esta felizmente casada con el señor Eleazar de  cincuenta y un años de edad un señor amable y trabajador.
Doña Emiliana también nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de tortillas echas a mano pero todavía  no piensa regresar al negocio de las tortillas solamente cuando se las encarguen, pero no hace tortilla todos los días por  que se calienta mucho los pulmones.
Doña Emiliana también se dedica a la venta de comida hace lo que es mole de pollo, caldo de pollo, caldo de pescado, barbacoa y abobo de marrano.
Doña Emiliana pidió el préstamo para la compra de más refrescos y más ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
Esta muy agradecida con fundacion ya que por ayudarla y así ganarse el pan que se lleva ala boca.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Roció- se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Elizabeth- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ignacia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Adela- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Adelaida- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Maria de Jesús- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Le dan las gracias  a  fundación por ayudarlas a valorar las cosas y sacarle provecho a  la vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Agua" and is made up of seven hard-working and modest women, who wish to make their businesses grow and improve their lives.

The members of this group are from Pinotepa Nacional in Oaxaca state, a land of hard-working people and progress; but also much hunger, as there are many poor people, although there are plenty who take more than their fair share.  

In Pinotepa the most popular dance is the Chilena. In Pinotepa there are small businesses and also many children playing in the park, and many women selling tamales in the streets of the community.

One of Pinotepa's traditions is the "Fifth Friday" holiday where there are a lot of fun and games in the streets for the children, and one can see the Pilgrimage, a play about the life of Jesus Christ. People go out to watch the youth who perform the play. For the people, that day is one of repentance and forgiveness, and a day to enjoy oneself and forgive others.

One of the members of this group is Maria Emiliana. She is 49, and known for being a friendly, hard-working woman, who is very proud of her roots and  her business.

Emilia, as she is better known by her fellow group members, sells soft drinks and tamales. She has been selling soft drinks and tamales for 20 years. 

What she likes best about selling tamales is the preparation. Emilia tells us that the tamales are prepared in the following way: First, heat the banana leaves and clean them. Then prepare the chili, adding add half an onion, puya and gaguillo chilis, garlic; then grind them together. Then wash the chicken meat and put it, together with the prepared chili on a large platter. Prepare the dough adding lard. To make a tortilla out of the dough, you place the leaf down, and put a bit of the dough on top and flatten it. Add both the chili and the chicken. Fold the leaf into the shape of a tamale, and put all of this together on the fire. Wait for them to cook, take them out of the pot, and let people know you have tamales, so that your customers come and buy from you.

Emiliana has six children: Maria de Jesús, Moisés, Eleazar, Francisco, Angelo and Juan José. They motivate her to keep going, as she really loves them and wants them to always count on her. Emiliana is happily married to Eleazar, 51, a friendly and hard-working man. 

Emiliana also tells us that she sells handmade tortillas, yet doesn't intend to return to the tortilla business: only when she has orders for them. She doesn't make tortillas every day, because making them is hard on the the lungs.

Emiliana also sells food, chicken mole (chicken in a spicy sauce), chicken soup, fish soup, barbecued meat, and abobo de marrano (marinated pork).

Emiliana requested the loan to buy more soft drinks and more ingredients for making tamales. She is very grateful to the Foundation for helping her earn her daily living.

The other members of the group are: Rocio, who sells candy; Elizabeth, who sells Mexican snack foods; Ignacia, who sells Mexican snack foods; Adela, who sells clothing; Adelaida, who sells clothing; and Maria de Jesús, who sells chickens.

They give thanks to the Foundation for helping them to appreciate things and benefit from life.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and ingredients for making tamales.

loans.name: Sonrisas Frente Al Mar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Sonrisas Frente al Mar” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía, preparación de productos de repostería, venta de abarrotes, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Raquel delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, sentada en la segunda silla de izquierda a derecha, su cabello es de color negro, usa flequillo y además está sonriendo.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía, específicamente a la realización de figuras y adornos en soft (para los materiales que se utilizan son panty media de color blanco, relleno con algodón sintético). Se desempeña a estas labores desde hace tres años. Comenta que una vecina le enseño el oficio. 
Su dinámica de trabajo es producir 25 figuritas de soft diarias, las cuales vende al por mayor a una distribuidora, la cual se encarga de realizar los detalles, para posteriormente venderlos. 
Trabaja de lunes a domingo en horario flexible. Comenta que las temporadas de más alta demanda son durante las celebraciones del día de los enamorados, día de la madre, fiestas patrias y navidad. Hace hincapié que durante todo el año vende la misma cantidad de productos, solo que las temporadas altas las ventas se acrecientan. 
Los materiales que necesita, los compra en diferentes distribuidoras de centros comerciales, las cuales venden insumos al por mayor.
Con el crédito comprará materiales para realizar sus figuras de artesanía en soft.
Una de las metas para su negocio, es instalarse con un local establecido.
Raquel vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos e 13, 11 y 9 años de edad, además comenta que tiene dos meses de embarazo, situación que la tiene muy contenta. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es comprarse un vehículo para trasladarse y costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos para que sean profesionales. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad económica brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en los insumos para su negocio. Además comenta que disfruta mucho de las reuniones y capacitaciones impartidas. Lo cual le ha permitido sociabilizar con las demás integrantes del grupo.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Sonrisas Frente al Mar” (Smiles Facing the Sea)  and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who have different businesses such as crafts, preparation of desserts, grocery sales, etc.  All of the members are from the city of Valparaíso.    

Raquel is the delegate of this lending group.  In the photo she is in the second row, seated in the second chair from the left.  She has black hair with bangs, and she is smiling.  Raquel creates crafts, specifically figures and adornments in "soft".  The materials she uses are white panty hose stuffed with synthetic cotton.  She has been doing this for 3 years.  A neighbor taught her this craft.

Her mode of work is to make 25 soft figures daily, which she sells wholesale to a distributor who does all of the details and then sells them. She works 7 days a week with a flexible schedule.  She says the seasons of highest demand are around Valentine's Day celebrations, Mother's Day, Independence celebrations, and Christmas. She tells us that she sells the same quantity of products during the whole year, but during the high seasons sales grow. She purchases the materials she needs from different distributors at shopping centers that sell supplies wholesale. She will use the loan to purchase the materials she needs to make her handicrafts.  One of her goals for her business is to set up her own shop. 

Raquel lives with her husband and her three children, ages 13, 11, and 9.  She is also two months pregnant, and very happy.  One of her dreams for her personal life is to purchase a car for transportation and to pay for college for her children so they can be professionals. 

She is very happy and thankful for the economic opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, as it allows her to invest in the materials for her business.  She also enjoys the meetings and training provided, which have allowed her to socialize with the rest of the members of the group. 

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and the seat of the National Congress.  It is the principal port in the country and has a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, such as the house of Pablo Neruda, the Nobel Prize winning poet.

loans.use: to purchase materials to create crafts.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung would like to take another loan to buy more food to sell in his store. Hung's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more food to serve and more furniture to expand his cafe

loans.name: Bok Khol 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Bok khol 3" est composé de cinq femmes, toutes mariées.Elles se sont organisées pour s'appuyer mutuellement dans leurs activités de commerce de produits alimentaires. Elles se cotisent chaque semaine pour constituer une épargne qui leur permet d'avoir des pret à l'UIMCEC.Elles prennent en charge leurs propres besoins ainsi que ceux de leur enfants avec les revenus générés par leur commerce.Afin d'augmenter leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter de l'arachide, du mil, des haricots et d'autres denrées de consommation courante.
texts.en: The BOK KHOL 3 group is made up of five women, all married.  They decided to form a group to support each other's retail food businesses.  They each contribute, on a weekly basis, to build up savings that allow them to receive loans from UIMCEC.  With the earnings they generate from their retail activities, they take care of their children's needs as well as their own.   In order to expand their business, they are requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for the purchase of groundnuts, millet, beans and other basic food products.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, millet, beans and other basic foods products.

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en: In the photo are members of the “United We Stand” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 4,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. The leader of this group is Ashiatu. Ashiatu is age thirty. She was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Ashiatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells flip-flops/ slippers. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of flip-flops/slippers to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy dozens of flip-flops/ slippers to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de un hijo de 14 años de edad, al cual ha criado sola ya que es madre soltera y por el cual ella trabaja día a día con tal de darle lo mejor y para que sea feliz; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener playas hermosas, por su agricultura en especial el cultivo del arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del mundo y por su riquísimo Chupe de Camarones, asimismo por la generosidad de sus pobladores.

Día a día Celestina se levanta muy temprano para salir a trabajar en su negocio de venta de refrescos de fruta en especial chicha, maracuyá y también refresco de cebada; ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas y puede atender hasta 70 clientes en el día, en algunas oportunidades trabaja como obrera agrícola, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque sus refrescos son agradables y por ello los clientes siempre le compran.

Celestina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella comprar azúcar en sacos para elaborar sus refrescos, así como también leña al por mayor para poder elaborar sus refrescos ya que ella cocina a leña; con esta mejora ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir luchando día a  día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Celestina is a very hardworking woman.  She has a 14 year old son whom she has raised alone since she is a single mother.  She works every day in order to provide him with the best and make him happy. Her home is located in the city of Camana, a city that is known for its beautiful beaches, its agriculture, especially rice, which is among the best in the world, for its delicious "chupe de camarones" (shrimp chowder), as well as for the generosity of its residents.

Celestina gets up very early every day to work at her business selling fruit drinks, especially chicha (purple corn), passion fruit, and refresco de cebada (a cold drink made form barley).  She works around 9 hours a day and may have up to 70 customers daily.  She also sometimes has the opportunity to work as an agricultural laborer.  She thinks her business does well because her drinks are good so her customers always buy from her. 

Celestina is very thankful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have provided she is able to buy sacks of sugar to make her drinks, and purchase firewood wholesale in order to make her drinks, as she cooks with firewood.  With this improvement she will be able to increase her income and continue fighting day by day to make her biggest dream a reality - to provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Association " Dental 12" Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Association dental 12" est composée de cinq femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires, agricoles notamment.Elles achètent en gros et se partagent les produits qu'elles revendent au détail.Ce commerce leur permet de se prendre en charge et d'appuyer leurs maris dans la prise en charge des dépenses de leurs familles respectives.Elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter du mil, des graines d'arachides, de la patte d'arachide, des haricots.Elles ambitionnent d'implanter un grand magasin au marché.
texts.en: The ASSOCIATION DENTAL 12 is a group made up of five women who are actively involved in selling food, particularly agricultural products.  They buy in bulk and then share the products among themselves before reselling them for retail.  This business enables them to provide for themselves and to help their husbands take care of their respective families' expenses.  They are requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for the purchase of millet, groundnuts, groundnut paste and beans.  Their ambition is to open a large store at the market.

loans.use: to buy millet, groundnuts, groundnut paste and beans.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.ru: Хамид проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его старший сын работает в пекарне. Сам Хамид имеет средне – специальное образование, механик. По профессии он работает более 20 лет. Также Хамид занимается торговлей продуктов питания оптом. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки строительный материалов, чтобы построить ларек рядом со складом.
texts.en: Hamid lives in the Gissar district.  He is 48 years old, married, and has seven children.  His oldest son works in a bakery.  Hamid completed secondary school, specializing in mechanics.  He has been working in this field for more than 20 years.  Additionally, he has also been selling food products in bulk for the past 10 years.  He is taking a loan for the purchase of building materials, which will be used to build a stall next to the warehouse.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia Santa Ana en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene grandes paisajes demostrándonos su belleza natural, desde el parque central se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales, comercio y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, se caracterizan por su hospitalidad, amabilidad y por mantener viva las costumbres, tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Rosa tiene 39 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 13, 9, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jardinero, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura cultivando sus propios terrenos, lo que cosecha para el consumo de su hogar y si existe sobrante lo vende. También cría gallinas, cuyes y cerdos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus cultivos.

Su meta es tener más cultivos para la venta y crecer en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 10 de Agosto communal bank. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana in the city of Cuenca. The climate there is cold and it has great landscapes that demonstrate its natural beauty. From the central park one can see a large part of the city of Cuenca. The people make their living in agriculture, raising animals, and retail, while many other work in a variety of businesses in the city. They are known for their hospitality, friendliness, and for keeping the traditions and customs of their communities alive. 

Rosa is 39 years old and she is in a civil union. She has five children who are 13, 9, 7, 5, and 3 years old. Her first three children are studying in a small school in area. Her husband works as a gardener. The house they live in is theirs.

Rosa works doing the household chores as well as working in agriculture planting her own plots. Her harvest is used for household consumption. If there is anything left over, she sells it. She also raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs.

She has been a member of her communal bank for five years. She will use this new loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer for her crops. Her goal is to plant more crops to sell and expand in raising animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: María Nieves

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia Santa Ana en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene grandes paisajes demostrándonos su belleza natural, desde el parque central se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales, comercio y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, se caracterizan por su hospitalidad, amabilidad y por mantener viva las costumbres, tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 67 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad, es una herencia de herencia de sus vis abuelos y tiene 150 años pero se encuentra deteriorado por el paso de los años. 

Doña María se dedica a lavar ropa ajena cuando le llaman y también labora cuidando a dos nietos. En su casa cría cuyes y pollos. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, un torete y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su sueño es arreglar su casa o construirse una nueva casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “10 de Agosto” communal bank. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana in the city of Cuenca. This place has a cool climate and great vistas showing the natural beauty. From the central park one can see a large portion of the city of Cuenca. Its people work in agriculture, raising animals, commerce, and many of the people work in the city in different businesses. The people are known for their hospitality, friendliness, and for keeping alive the customs and traditions of their peoples. 

María is 67 years old. She is a widow. During her marriage she had 6 children, all of whom are grown, married, and live independently. The house where she lives is her own property. It was an inheritance of an inheritance from her great-grand parents, and it is 150 years old, and it has deteriorated with the passing of the years.

María washes other people’s clothes for a living when they call her, and she also takes care of two grandchildren. She raises guinea pigs and chickens at her house.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 6 years. She will use her loan to buy pigs, a bull, and feed for her animals.

Her dream is to fix up her house or to build herself a new one.

loans.use: to buy pigs, a bull, and feed for animals.

loans.name: Ana Ricarda

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia Santa Ana en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene grandes paisajes demostrándonos su belleza natural, desde el parque central se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales, comercio y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, se caracterizan por su hospitalidad, amabilidad y por mantener viva las costumbres, tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Ana tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de los que 2 son casados y viven independientes, una de su hija soltera trabaja y estudia en la universidad, sus dos últimos hijos tienen 14 y 13 años y estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad. 

Doña Ana labora desde hace 15 años en un taller de tapicería que es propiedad de su hermana y trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. En su casa cría cuyes y patos. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir como parte de pago de un terreno que está comprando. 

Su meta es  mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the 10 de Agosto communal bank. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana in the city of Cuenca. The climate there is cold and it has great landscapes that demonstrate its natural beauty. From the central park one can see a large part of the city of Cuenca. The people make their living in agriculture, raising animals, and retail, while many other work in a variety of businesses in the city. They are known for their hospitality, friendliness, and for keeping the traditions and customs of their communities alive.

Ana is 53 years old, she is married and has had five children as a result of this union. Two of her children are married and live independently. One of her daughters is single, works, and studies at the university. Her two youngest children are 14 and 13 years old and they study at the local high school. Her husband works as a security guard. The house they live in is their own. 

Ana has worked for 15 years in an upholstery workshop that her sister owns. She works there from Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule. In her home she raises guinea pigs and ducks. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years. She will invest this new loan as part of a payment for some land that she is buying. Her goal is to improve her house.

loans.use: to pay for part of the purchase of land.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao would like to take a further loan to buy materials to make a larger quantity of school bags to sell to her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to make school bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy one calf to expand the business.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase products such as food and beverages for her general store

loans.name: Ubaydulo

texts.ru: Убайдулло житель Гиссарского района. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается производством кирпича. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Убайдуло хочет закупить крупнорогатый скот и одновременно заняться скотоводством. Он берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Ubaydulo is a resident of the Gissar region. He is 44 years old, he is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He is in the business of manufacturing bricks. He has been in this business for five years. Ubaydulo wants to buy large horned cattle and simultaneously start breeding cattle. He is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Duy

texts.en: Duy is requesting a new loan to buy materials and machines to increase his production of frames. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality machines for his frame-making business

loans.name: Chien

texts.en: Chien is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new electrical products to sell at his store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.
