loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a 61-year-old married man, a father of 5 children and the husband of a businesswoman. He lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zambo. del Sur.

Romulo used his last loan to purchase seedlings. His business been profitable, and he is taking a new loan to acquire more products such as shampoo, milks, soaps and etc.  In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to acquire more products such as shampoo, milks, soaps and etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines.  Her husband is Perfecto, a seaman. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Victoria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Victoria dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es socia del Bancomunal Las Entusiastas, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de un hijo, es dueña de un moto-taxi,   es socia FINCA Perú hace 2 años, las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal le ayudan en su vida personal así como en su negocio ya que ahora va a invertir en un nuevo negocio que es la venta de palomitas de maíz, esta muy feliz por todo lo que ha logrado ahorrar, y orgullosa de todo lo que pudo lograr.Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina para hacer palomitas de maíz.
texts.en: Elsa is a member of 'Las Entusiastas' community bank.  She is 27 years old and has one child.  She owns a motorcycle taxi.  Elsa has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years.  The training sessions she receives as a member of her community bank help her in her personal life and also in her business.  She is about to invest in a new business selling popcorn.  She is very happy with what she has managed to save and proud of everything she has been able to accomplish.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying a popcorn machine.

loans.use: to buy a machine for making popcorn

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 5 years, Marilyn has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, snacks and beverages. Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, shampoo, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 54 years old and lives in Brgy. 2, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 
Marilou has a  business of general store and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan amount of 10,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store . Marilou joined PMPC just this year.
In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 38, is married and resides with her husband, three children and a sister in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sticky rice cake for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. Her sister is a clothes seller who earns about USD 8 per day. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Nary is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more clothes for her sister to sell. This loan would enable her to get more fashionable clothes to sell and attract more clients. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately 3 U.S. dollars (USD) per day. Her husband runs a public-transportation service (motor taxi) and earns about 6 USD per day. Because his present motorbike is too old, Vanna is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a new motorbike for him to run his taxi service. This purchase will enable her husband to attract more customers and generate more income to support the family. In the future, Vanna would like to run a sewing shop, build a concrete house, and help her children get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his public-transportation service (motor taxi)

loans.name: Savon

texts.en: Savon, 39, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about USD 3 per day. Since the land in the village next to her house is cheap, Savon requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase land in order to resell it for a profitable price. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase land in order to resell it for a profitable price.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Marilou is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cooking stove.  She is getting the Envirofit cooking stove because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Marilou is aware that by using the Envirofit cooking stove, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cooking stove.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: This time, for her 8th cycle loan, Erlinda is borrowing Php 18,000 to buy more dry goods to sell to her customers.  This business was previously funded through KIVA partner and NWTF continues to provide for Erlinda and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her dry goods business.

loans.name: Manuelen

texts.en:
Manuelen works hard to support 5 children. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night. Manuelen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is separated and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy an envirofit cooking stove.  She is getting the envirofit because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer. Envirofit stoves needs less fuel to cook food.

Rosalinda is aware that by using the envirofit, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an envirofit cooking stove.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a frozen food business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.

Editha requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen food to sell.  In the future, Editha  would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 59 years old. He is married to Hellen and together they have three children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He was introduced to KADET by a client. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

He hopes to purchase another plot of land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal lives in Sagarejo District. He is 27 years old and lives with his family: parents and grandmother (retired). The family earns a living through agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with 5 milk cows. Jemal’s mother produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. Along with the above mentioned, the family runs a pig farm with 5 piglets. They sell on average 40 piglets per year. Also, Jemal and his family are busy with their 3 hectare plot of the land, where melons are grown. 

Jemal requested credit for renting a tractor for tilling the land and purchasing fertilizers. After tilling and fertilizing the land, Jemal will sow melons. He and his parents will work hard on the plot during spring and summer seasons. They hope that the weather conditions are favorable as well and the family gets a good harvest in late summer. Jemal plans to sell the harvest to local greengrocery product retailers. The family will get profit, which will be used for family members’ living conditions improvement.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is 67 years old. She lives in Sagarejo District with her husband Merlen. Both Lena and Merlen are retired. Along with the pension they get from the government, the main source of the income for the family is the dairy farm, owned by the family. They have 3 milk cows. Lena produces cheese and sells it on the local market to dairy product retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 GEL, including their monthly pension. 

Lena requested credit for purchasing calves. Lena will place calves in an existing cattle-shed. She will raise them for 5-6 months and sell the grown calves in early fall. The family will get additional profit. Lena plans to use increased income for renovation of the house, which is already old and needs some make-up.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Fayez

texts.en: Fayez is a 49-year-old, married man from Gaza. He lives with his four children and wife. In 2010, Fayez opened his own cell phone store in Gaza. He hopes to get this loan in order to buy new phones and shelves for his store. By carrying more products, Fayez's store would be able to serve more customers and increase its profitability.

loans.use: to buy new phones and shelves for his store

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 24 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 1 child. 

Grace has a dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Grace has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Grace hopes to build a stall for her dried fish vending business. Grace is the leader of a 3 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a wood lamination business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 5 years.  She also earns more income from a general store.

Mercedes is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her wood lamination business.  Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy materials for her wood lamination business

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Saroeun is 20 years old and married with one girl. She lives in a cottage with bamboo walls in a rural area of Kompong Cham province. To earn a living in her village, she has been farming rice on her small plot of farmland for around six years. It's only primary source of income for her family to support the living. Saroeun earns about US$2.5 per day from her current source of income and manages to save only around US$0.5 each day. 

She leads a group of three members, all of whom are female. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. This is her first loan with VisionFund and she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to farm her rice healthily and she hopes to produce good quality rice so that she can sell it at a good price. She is planning to use the money from the rice sales to have a proper house for living in and set aside some savings to send her daughter to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Emil

texts.en:
Emil is a 27-year-old man who sells meat. He is married and has two children. He has 2 years of experience in this field. He usually sells mutton and beef. Emil chose this particular activity because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and most of the national dishes, like dolma and pilau, are made of meat.

He usually wakes up at 5 a.m. to reach the livestock bazaar and purchase cattle and sheep. People use fresh meat in dishes and he very carefully chooses animals for sale. His wife helps him to run the business. Emil's monthly income is 300 AZN.  Emil says that he cuts one cow and two sheep in a day, but people buy everything in one-two hours and he is not satisfying clients' demand.

He applied for 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle and sheep for meat and increase his monthly turnover as well as cover clients' demand.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and sheep

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ysabel es una joven madre de 21 años de edad, su pequeño tiene 5 meses de edad al cual ama muchísimo y por el cual tiene la fuerza para seguir adelante ya que él es su mejor motivación, Isabel nos comenta que cuando esta triste o preocupada por diversas razones el ver el rostro de sus bebe hace que se olvide de todo y saca fuerzas de donde no las tiene para seguir y seguir adelante, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser la cuna de las grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo se caracteriza porque sus pobladores tienen un gran talento en la preparación de platillos ya que tienen una buena sazón. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida peruana pro ello uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “pescado frito con frejoles”, debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administración.

Con esfuerzo Ysabel logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa,  trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es carismática y amable con los clientes.

Ysabel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio en especial ropa para la campaña de día de la Madre, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando día a día para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Isabel is a young, 21-year-old mother.  Her little one is 5 months old and she loves him dearly.  He gives her the strength she needs to make progress and he is her best source of motivation.  Ysabel tells us that whenever she is sad or worried for any reason, just seeing her baby's face makes her forget everything and she is able to draw on hidden reserves of strength so that she can keep going and keep making progress.  Isabel's home is located in the city of Chincha.  This city is known as the birthplace of some of Peru's sporting legends.  It is also well known because its residents have a great talent for preparing very flavorful food.  Like all good Peruvians, Isabel really enjoys Peruvian cuisine.  One of her favorite dishes is the delicious fried fish with beans.  Owing to her family's limited economic means, Isabel was only able to study up to the fifth year of her secondary education.  She would have liked to have studied Business Management.

Isabel worked hard and managed to set up a business selling clothing.  She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is charming and kind to her customers.

Isabel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help that they provide, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.  In particular, she will buy clothing to sell in the run up to Mothers' Day.  This will enable her to improve her income and she will be able to continue working hard every day so that she can fulfill her biggest dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing for Mothers' Day)

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 28 years old, married to John and blessed with two school-going children. She has been operating her tailoring business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.

Regina is now requesting her first loan to buy more sewing materials e.g., threads, needles and clothes in order to boost her business. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and earn more income to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to boost her tailoring business by buying sewing threads and needles.

loans.name: Surbeh Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Surbeh” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old woman is married to a contractor and they have three children attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells babies' wear. With her share of this loan, she will buy baby clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes at wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver is 49 years old. He lives in a village of the Baghdati District with his family: his wife, Madona, and their 20-year-old daughter. She is a student. 

Enver works as bread distributor in a local bread bakery. Madona is teacher in a local school. Along with their main jobs, the family members are busy with a family agricultural business. They have a vineyard with 800 vines. Enver produces wine and sells it in the village. Also the family has 10 beehives with bee colonies. Madona harvests and sells on average 130 liters of honey per year. It is sold in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 950 GEL.

Enver requested a loan to purchase medicines for his bees. They will be used for protecting the bees from various deceases. Also a small part of the loan will be used for purchasing drugs for treating the vines against parasites. 

As a result of the above mentioned investment, the family will get a better harvest of honey and grapes and increase their income. Enver and Madona will use the increased income for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for bees.

loans.name: Sayani

texts.en:
Sayani is a 36-year-old man who is married and has five children. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing it for the last four years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of land and how to work it. He was not able to find a job for several years and so then he decided to start his own business. 
 
Sayani usually raise seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthful. Also, one of the favorite national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes, and juices are most likely made from fresh fruits. His monthly income from this business is 400 AZN. This is the only source of income in his family.

Now Sayani would like to invest more capital to his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose, he applied for 1,000 AZN. He hopes this loan will improve the life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en:
Mammad is 50, married, and has three children. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing it for the last 20 years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of land and how to work it. 

Mammad usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthful. Also one of the favorite national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is 250 AZN. This is the only source of income in his family.

Now Mammad would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he applied for 1,000 AZN. He hopes this loan will improve the life of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana, 41 years old, lives in Vani District with her husband Sergo and two daughters, 17 and 16 years of age, both of whom attend school. A teacher in the local school, Nana is also actively involved in the family agricultural business.

With a small dairy farm consisting of two milk cows, Nana and Sergo produce and sell on average 40 kg of cheese per month to local dairy product retailers. The family also has a vineyard with 1000 vine-trees, producing wine that Sergo sells in the village. Total average family monthly income is 850 Laris.

Nana is now requesting a loan to purchase vine-tree saplings to plant, and after four-five years the family will start to harvest more grapes. Sergo will be able to produce more wine and thereby increase income from wine-sales. The family will use the increased income to finance the education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase vine-tree saplings.

loans.name: Taliko

texts.en:
Taliko is 60 years old. She lives in a village in the Baghdati district with her family, including her husband, Anzor, 39-year-old son and two grandsons (19 and 15 years old). Her younger grandson goes to school while the elder one helps the family members in the family's agricultural business. They have three milk cows. 

Taliko produces cheese and sells it on the local market to dairy-products retailers. The family has 1 hectare of land, where they grow maize and 500 wine trees. Taliko and Anzor sell harvested products locally to retailers as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 GEL.

Taliko has requested credit to purchase kids (baby goats). She will keep them in the family farm for four to five months and then sell the grown goats for a higher price. This will provide additional profit for the family. They will use the money for finalizing construction of a new house for their son’s family.

loans.use: to purchase kids (baby goats).

loans.name: Gérard

texts.fr:
Gérard est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est célibataire. 
Gérard travaille comme coiffeur depuis 2006. Il coiffe tous les clients dans son atelier. Il travaille seul. Au moment il n’a pas de difficultés majeures. 
Gérard a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’ouvrir un second salon de coiffure. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Gérard voudrait ouvrir d’autres salons de coiffure. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de se marier et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gérard is a 26 year old man. He is single.
Gérard has been working as a hairdresser since 2006. He takes care of his customers in his salon. He works alone. At the moment, he doesn't have any major difficulties.
Gérard is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to open a second hairdressing salon. He wants to reinvest in his business.
Over the coming years, Gérard would like to open other hairdressing salons. He says that he plans to use any profits to get married and to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To develop his hairdressing salon and open another salon

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Adjowa est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un déclarant en douane. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 19 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.
Adjowa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Adjowa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjowa voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjowa is a 47 year old woman. She is married to a customs officer. She has three children who all attend school. The eldest is 19 and the youngest is 15.
Adjowa has been working as a retailer since 1996. She sells general food supplies for all her customers at the market. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her main problem is running out of supplies.
Adjowa is requesting her third loan from WAGES in order to purchase general food supplies. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Adjowa would like to open a shop. She says that she plans to use any profits to ensure that her family is able to flourish.

loans.use: To buy general food supplies

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 26 years old. She is married to Isaac and together they have one child. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She was introduced to KADET by a client. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

She hopes to improve her farming so as to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Mansim

texts.en:
Mansim is a 48-year-old man who is married and has three children. He was not able to find job for several years and then decided to start his own business.

He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing it for the last 12 years. His monthly income from this business is 300 AZN. This is the only source of income in his family.

He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of land and how to work it. 
  
Mansim usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthful. Also, one of the favorite national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. 

Now Mansim would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he applied for 1,000 AZN. He hopes this loan will improve the life of his family. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Muxtar

texts.en:
Muxtar is a 33-year-old trader who is married with three children. After making several attempts to find a job, he decided to start his own business. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Muxtar has three years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled businessperson.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and they are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling these foods is 230 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in his shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, which is in the central bazaar of his home city.

Muxtar would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in his business. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN, with which he will purchase additional foodstuffs. This will be his second loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy additional foodstuffs to sell in his store.

loans.name: Gogita

texts.en:
Gogita is 24 years old. He lives in a small village in the Vani District with his family: his 21-year-old wife, their 4-year-old son and his mother. 

The family earns a living through agricultural business. They have a milk cow and they produce cheese and sell on average 20 kg. of this product on the local market to dairy products retailers. Also they have .75 hectare of land, with 400 vines and 200 nut trees. Gogita sells harvested products on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 GEL.

Gogita requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. With two milk cows, the family will be able to increase production and sales of cheese by 100%. It will increase the average monthly income of the family by approximately 150 GEK, about a 40% increase. The family will use the increased income for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Kiziro

texts.en:
Kiziro is a 40-year-old married man with four children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the decorations business for eight years. He started with 100 chairs and two tents, and he now has four tents and 300 chairs. 

Kiziro's hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital and seasonal weather. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to diversify his business and move to a permanent location. Kiziro is requesting a loan to buy tents for this business.

loans.use: to buy tents for his business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 35-year-old lady married with three children and living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a restaurant business which she has run for a period of one year. She started the business with capital saved from her salary while working as a bursar in a school. She says inadequate capital and customers not paying on time are affecting the business. Pauline would like to educate her children and expand her business to new markets. She wants a loan to buy sodas and beers for sale.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for sale.

loans.name: Téko

texts.fr: Téko est homme âgé de 56ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et a 03 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 20ans et le dernier 16ans. Il exerce comme activité la vente d’extincteur à toutes personnes dans sa boutique. Il est aidé par 02 personnes et a commencé en 2007.  Il sollicite ce second crédit de WAGES pour acheter plus d’extincteurs et accessoires. Il veut augmenter son fonds propres pour ouvrir d’autres boutiques afin d’avoir plus de contrats avec les grandes sociétés. Il voudrait que sa famille soit financièrement autonome.
texts.en: Téko is a 56 year old man. He is married to a retailer and has 03 children of whom 02 are in school. The eldest is 20 and the youngest is 16. He has a business selling fire extinguishers in his shop to everyone. He is assisted by 02 people and began his activity in 2007. He is requesting his second loan from WAGES in order to buy more fire extinguishers and accessories. He wants to increase his own funds so that he can open other stores and get more contracts with large companies. He wants his family to become financially independent.

loans.use: To buy fire extinguishers and accessories

loans.name: Yalcin

texts.en:
Yalcin is a 40-year-old man who is married and has two children. He sells fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas, and also vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots and cabbage. Yalcin has six years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. His wife helps him to run the business. 

Fruits and vegetables are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand throughout the year. People like to eat fresh fruits and this is one of the main desserts for guests. Vegetables are also in high demand because people use them fresh in everyday life as well as in cooking. 

His shop is located in the central bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits and vegetables. His monthly income from this business is 200 AZN. 

Yalcin wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as improve the life of his family. For this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to buy more products and increase turnover.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is married with one child. He runs a hardware store to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. To earn extra income he runs a motorcycle transport business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy grinding disks, nails, and iron sheets for sale.

loans.use: To buy grinding disks, nails, and iron sheets for sale.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman with three children. She sells shoes in Gikomba and has been in the business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more shoes for resale. In the future she wants to improve the business and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, tiene la edad  de 65 años, está casada,  vive con la esposa y el suegro  actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar la semilla y las bolsas para hacer el almacigo y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar semilla de buena calidad para realizar un almacigo de excelente condiciones y poder venderlo en el mercado de la localidad y lugares aledaños, y asi  obtener ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Félix is sixty-five-years-old, married, and currently lives with his wife and father-in-law.  He intends to use his loan to hire some help and buy seeds and sacks so he can plant his seedbed.  He's planning to buy high-quality seeds so he'll have an excellent crop and be able to sell at local markets and neighboring areas.  That way he'll bring in income for a better quality of life and financial stability.  

This will be Félixes first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received any prior loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the simplest loan and has a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: for coffee seeds.

loans.name: Yender Augusto

texts.es:
YENDER AUGUSTO tiene 34 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

YENDER AUGUSTO trabaja en un taller de enderezada y pintura de vehículos y motocicletas. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar taladros, pintura, barniz, soplete. Con la ayuda del crèdito podra comprar los materiales que necesita sin ningùn contratiempo.

Las compras lo hace en la ciudad de Guaranda cada semana.  El sueño es poder comprar un terreno, adquirir equipo moderno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta a pesar de que los ingresos son bajos es apoyar a los hijos para los estudios.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte cómo el baskett y tocar la guitarra.
texts.en:
Yender Augusto is thirty-four, married, and has two children.  He lives with his wife and kids in Guaranda in Bolivar Province.

Yender Augusto works in a motorcycle paint and body shop.  He's seeking a loan so he can buy drills, paint, varnish, and a spray gun.  The loan will allow him to buy the supplies he needs without any difficulty.

He makes his purchases every week in the city of Guaranda.  His dream is to be able to buy some land and to get some modern equipment.  The challenge posed to him by his low income is supporting his children's education.  

In his free time, Yender Augusto plays sports, like basketball, and plays the guitar.

loans.use: to be able to buy drills, paint, varnish, and a spray gun.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 53-year-old man who is married with five children. Hasan has bred cattle for the last 20 years. He and his wife raise and fatten cattle.

Hasan usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 230 AZN. This business is only one source of financial income for the family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  

Hasan wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase two calves, one milk cow and fodder. This will be his third loan, and he has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy two calves, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 32 years old and single. He operates a pharmacy and has been in the business for the past eight months.

This is his first term loan with KADET. He was introduced to KADET by a client. He will use the loan to purchase stock of medicine to add to the stock in his pharmacy for sale.

He hopes to be a medicine distributor.

loans.use: Purchase medicine to stock his pharmacy.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia Del Carmen es una emprendedora que se le ha apoyado en el crédito en el cual aprovechado ya que ha aumentado su mercadería y su cliente por que le ofrece variedad de productos.  Durante el financiamiento ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con muchas metas que una de ellas es ampliar su negocio. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como zapatos deportivos, sandalias, botas , chinelas playeras, zapatillas entre otros estilos zapatos que le buscan sus clientes.
texts.en: Lucia Del Carmen is an entrepreneur who has received the support of a previous loan.  It helped her to increase her merchandise and also her number of customers as she is now able to offer them a variety of products.  Over the course of her previous loan, she showed herself to be a responsible person with many goals, one of which is expanding her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products such as sports shoes, sandals, boots, flip-flops (thongs) for the beach, sneakers and other styles of shoes that her customers are looking for.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes, sandals, boots, flip-flops (thongs), sneakers, etc.

loans.name: Tedy Jose

texts.es: Tedy José, tiene la edad  de 27 años, está casada,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar  muchos utensilios domésticos para su posterior venta. El tiene un localito a su poder, en el cual tiene pensado vender los utensilios domésticos para generar ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Tedy José is 27 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children.  He plans to use his loan to buy a lot of home products which he will later sell.  He has small premises where he plans to sell these products.  This will make him profits and he will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and financial stability.

This is the first loan that Tedy José has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from State banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy housewares

loans.name: Gulaya

texts.en: Gulaya is 46, lives in Bilasuva, and has four children as her dependents. She is an IDP from the city of Cabrayil. Gulaya makes a living by raising small animals like sheep and poultry. She currently has eight sheep and ten ducks. When they reach the ideal weight, she will sell them at the local market. She has been engaged in this business for ten years. Gulaya requested a loan in the amount of 600 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to buy feed for her animals. In this way, her animals will grow in better conditions and will look better to the merchants. Gulaya hopes to have a successful business and a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Adjratou

texts.fr: Adjratou est une femme de 42ans. Elle est mère de 02 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 18ans et le dernier 13ans. Son conjoint est transitaire. Depuis 1998, Elle a commencé par vendre les pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Vu que ses demandes augmentent et qu’elle n’a pas de ressources financières solides pour mieux répondre à ses clients, elle sollicite auprès de WAGES son second crédit pour acheter des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité, augmenter le fonds de commerce et assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjratou is a 42-year-old mother of two children aged 13 and 18 who both go to school. Her spouse is a freight agent. She started to sell pagnes in 1998, and she buys her stock in Lomé. 

With demand increasing, and given her lack of financial resources to meet the needs of her customers, she is seeking a second loan from WAGES to buy pagnes. She wants to reinvest in her activity, increase her working capital, and provide a good education for her children

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly parent). Susan has a pub. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Susan sells her products in her pub, retail.

 Susan has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity  The main business challenges for Susan include the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also buy a plot of land and build her own house. 

Susan lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es: María es socia del Bancomunal Urpicha II, tiene 44 años de edad, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace mas de 1 año, es casada, le gusta participar de las reuniones de su Bancomunal por que comparte con su Promotora sus experiencias y le gusta las capacitaciones que ahí le dan por que le ayudan a mejorar su negocio, gracias a ello aumentó los ingresos de su negocio, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en  compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar,aceite,fideos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank "Urpicha II". She is 44 years old and the owner of a grocery store. María is married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than a year. María enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because the promoter shares her experiences. She enjoys the training classes because they have helped her to improve her business. As a result, the income from her business has increased.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, oil, and noodles.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 66 years old. He is married to Zipporah and together they have six children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. He will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm.

He hopes to diversify and be a dairy farmer.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan, age 27, is married and has a daughter. He lives with his family in Bilasuvar.  Sanan is an Internally Displaced Person from the city of Cabrayil. He has a business raising and selling sheep.

The loan he requested from AqroInvest and Kiva for 1000 AZN is to buy some sheep to raise and later sell. He says that the price for these animals is very good. This will allow him to increase his income. He is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy some sheep to raise

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine is 30 years old, and she runs a cosmetics shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Margarita Rosario

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer muy luchadora, vive al lado de sus padres a los cuales adora mucho y a quienes apoya de manera incondicional, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus playas hermosas y por sus atractivos turísticos los cuales son el Candelabro de paracas y las Islas ballestas, las cuales reciben a infinidad de turistas por ser lugares hermosos.  Con mucho esfuerzo Margarita inicio su negocio de venta de verduras, pero no le iba muy bien que digamos pero con esfuerzo pudo incrementar su negocio y ahora no solo vende verduras sino también abarrotes y bebidas gaseosas y su negocio mejoro mucho, ella se dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque ofrece productos de calidad y con variedad.

Margarita está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a ala ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, conservas, fideos, entre otros, así como también construir 2 paredes en su vivienda ya que debido al terremoto perdió su casa y ahora vive en un modulo, con esta mejora podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá tener más seguridad en su vivienda, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando día  a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Margarita is a very hard-working woman who lives together with her parents who she loves very much and who she supports unconditionally.  Her home is located in the city of Pisco.  This city is noted for its warm climate, its beautiful beaches and its tourist attractions such as the 'Candelabra of the Andes' (a well-known prehistoric geoglyph) and the Ballestas Islands, which receive a large number of tourists as they are beautiful places.  Margarita worked very hard to set up her vegetable business.  It did not do very well at first but, with a lot of effort, she managed to expand her business and now she not only sells vegetables but also groceries and soda.  Her business has improved a lot.  Margarita works around 10 hours a day and she believes that her business is doing well because she is very kind to her customers and offers a variety of good-quality products.

Margarita is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, canned food, noodles, etc.  She will also be able to build two walls in her home because she lost her house in an earthquake and now lives in a pre-fabricated home.  These improvements will enable her to improve her income and have a safer home.  In this way, she will be able to continue working hard every day in order to make her biggest dream come true: to finish building her home and improve her parents' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, etc.) for her business and to build some walls in her home

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабибулло 33 года, он женат и имеет 2 детей. Его основной деятельностью является починка старой обуви. Каждый день он приходит на свое рабочее место рано утром и начинает готовиться к приему клиентов. Он очень хорошо умеет чинить и шить обувь и поэтому у него много постоянных клиентов. Его отец тоже имеет такую же профессию и поэтому она досталась Хабибулло в наследство. Его занятие является основным доходом для семьи, так как его жена нигде не работает и занимается домашним хозяйством и воспитанием малолетних детей. Кроме того что Хабибулло занимается ремонтом и шитьем обуви, он также занимается откором мелко-рогатого скота дома. Его жена помогает ему в этом. У него дома есть собственный скот в количестве 5 голов. Хабибулло узнал, что можно получить кредит и приобрести дополнительно скот. С этой целью он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. На полученный кредит он собирается приобрести 4 голов баранов.
texts.en: Habibullo is thirty-three, married, and has two children.  His primary line of work is mending old shoes.  Every day he gets to work early and starts receiving customers.  He is really good at stitching and repairing shoes, so he has a lot of steady clients.  His father is in the same line of work so he passed the business on to Habibullo.  Habibullo's job is his family's main source of income; his wife is a homemaker and raises their young children, and doesn't have an outside job.  In addition to stitching and repairing shoes, Habibullo raises small livestock at home, and his wife helps him out.  He has had his own livestock at home for five years.   Habibullo found out it was possible to get a loan to buy more sheep, so he approached Arvand.  He'll use his loan to purchase four head of sheep.

loans.use: to buy four sheep.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is 34 years old, married, and has two children. His business activity is selling the milk products, and his wife helps him in his business. 

Ilqar is requesting a loan for 1,200 AZN, which he will use to buy animals, especially a cow with its calf. His family is very important to him and what he wants most is to improve their standard of living, especially for his children who are his greatest inspiration.

loans.use: to purchase a cow with its calf.

loans.name: San Rafael 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 12 miembros de la ciudad de Encarnación. El comité  tiene  experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que  son varios meses  los que trabajan juntas. Ellas se reúnen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo. 
Una de las integrantes, Nelly es viuda, tiene 3 hijos, ella tiene una despensa pero que su deseo es poder surtir mejor su despensa y así poder generar más ingresos para su familia, ya que el dinero que gana no les alcanza. Su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, fideos, yerba y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 12 members from the city of Encarnación. For the past several months, they have gained experience working together as a group. Each week they meet in order to share, communicate, and internalize the new experiences they have learned as a group.

One of the members is Nelly. She is a widow with three children. Nelly operates a food pantry, but her wish is to better stock her business so that she can generate more income for her family. The money she earns is not enough. Her goal is to continue growing so that she can help her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beverages, dairy products, noodles, herbs, and other necessary items to restock her business. This will enable her to continue offering a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, noodles, herbs, and other items.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for seven years. He started with UGX 4,000,000 and now has UGX 7,000,000. His hardships are price fluctuation and inflation, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are educating children and building a permanent house. His business goals are hiring employees to help expand his business and expanding to new markets. Godfrey wants money to buy sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Ealiya

texts.en:
Ealiya, from southern Israel, is married and the mother of six. She sells gold pieces from her home. Ealiya purchases the gold at wholesale prices and resells to customers.

She needed this loan to purchase stock and renovate an area of her home to utilize as her store.

In the future she wants to move her shop outside of her house and one day purchase a home of her own.

loans.use: To purchase stock and renovate an area of her home to utilize as her store.

loans.name: Vlad

texts.en:
Vlad is 37 years old. He lives in Baghdati District with his retired parents. Vlad earns a living through agricultural business. He owns a vineyard with 800 grape vines. Vlad produces wine and vodka and sells them in the village. Also he is busy with bee-keeping. The family has 4 bee-hives. Vlad sells harvested honey in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris, including the pensions of Vlad’s parents. 

Vlad requested credit for purchasing a plot of land. He will sow various vegetables there and sell harvested products on the local open market. The income of the family will increase and they will use it for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Las Calladitas Del Olivo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Las Calladitas del Olivo” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran la artesanía en bisutería, venta de ropa nueva y usada, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo.
Lorena presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la tercera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Su cabello es corto y rubio. Además viste con una polera color blanco y abraza a otra de las integrantes.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa estilo hindú, además de carteras. Se desempeña en este rubro desde hace 5 años.
Cuenta con un permiso, que le permite vender sus productos en un puesto que ubica en una feria artesanal. Trabaja los fines de semana y festivos, durante todo el día.
Su clientela es fija y la conserva desde que comenzó su negocio.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras, en las cuales encuentre los precios más convenientes.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
Lorena vive junto a sus tres hijos de 29, 27 y 20 años de edad. Quienes trabajan y estudian. Uno de sus sueños en el ámbito personal es remodelar su casa y brindarles a sus nietos una mejor calidad de vida, específicamente una buena calidad en su educación. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el apoyo ha sido significativo para su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del banco comunal del cual forma parte está muy afiatado. Respecto de las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones ha aprendido nuevas estrategias de contabilidad e inversión para su negocio.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en: This communal bank is called "Las Calladitas del Olivo" ("The silent young women of the olive tree") and is made of 17 entrepreneurs, who have different activities, making artisanal jewellery or selling new and second-hand clothes among others. All of them live in the town of San Bernardo. Lorena is the president of this communal bank: in the picture, she is on the second row from the top, fourth person from the right, with short blond hair, wearing a white shirt and with her arm around one of the other women. She has been selling Hindu-like clothing as well as handbags for 5 years. She has a permit that allows her to sell products from a stand she sets up at an artisans' fair. She works all day every day, including week-ends and bank holidays. Her customer base is loyal and has been with her since she started her business. She buys her merchandise from several suppliers, depending on which offers the best prices. With this loan, she will buy merchandise to supply her stand. Lorena lives with her three children, aged 29, 27, and 20, who work and study. One of her personal dreams is to renovate her house and offer her grandchildren a better quality of life, particularly when it comes to education. She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity afforded her by Fondo Esperanza, since its support has been crucial for her business. She says that the communal bank group of which she is a member is very tightly knit. Thanks to the information imparted during meetings, she was able to learn new accounting and investing strategies for her business. San Bernardo is a town located 18 km to the south of Santiago's (the capital of Chile) main square in a straight line. It is known as the capital of folklore, since every year in January it hosts the International Folklore Festival, an event which showcases the country's roots and attracts musical ensembles from all over South America. The Traditional Artisans' Fair, also in January, draws Chilean and neighbouring countries' artisans to the town. In April, the town hosts the "Abril cuecas Mil" ("A thousand cuecas in April") festival, during which all the locals dance cuecas (a traditional Chilean dance).

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Clara Maria

texts.es: Clara Maria es una emprendedora que toda su vida ha luchado por salir adelante y buscar el alimento de su familia, esta emprendedora ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, aprovechando la oportunidad y ha aumentado su mercadería para ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como pantalones, camisas, sandalias, blusas, faldas, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Clara Maria is a businesswoman who has worked hard throughout her life to get ahead and support her family. She partners with Fundación León 2000 and has used the opportunity to buy more stock for her business and thus offer her customers a wide variety. Clara Maria is now seeking a loan to buy pants, shirts, sandals, blouses, skirts etc.

loans.use: pants, shirts, sandals, blouses, skirts etc.

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban is a 48-year-old married man raising his two sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) coming originally from the city of Cabrayil.

Qurban has been involved in caring for dairy cows to sell for over ten years. Now, he is currently caring for four cows. In order to sell his cows at a higher price, he requested a loan of 1000 AZN to buy feed and vitamins. He hopes to gain enough income to provide a good education for his children because this business is the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida, 55, is married and has 6 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person from the city of Cabrayil and currently lives in Bilasuvar. Her family's only source of income is selling vegetables and fresh fruit. She started the business 13 years ago, selling fresh products to customers. 

This is her first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. It’s for 1000 AZN that she needs to stock up on more fruit and vegetables and also to repair her vehicle which is her work tool so that she can continue getting from place to place as she has done to date. Valida's goal in life is to continue working to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to stock up with more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 26 years old, married to Joseph, and they have one child. She owns a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru and has operated it for the past year.

This will be her first loan and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of tea leaves, washing detergents, and matchboxes for sale in her retail shop.

In the future, Purity hopes to grow her business and make more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves, washing detergents, and matchboxes for sale.

loans.name: Hiram

texts.en:
Hiram is single, and he has a mobile phone accessories and repair business in Kiambu. He has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.


This will be his first  loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase mobile phone accessories.  With the profits, he would like to expand his business and stock electrical appliances. 

In future he wants to expand his business to five shops and build rental houses on his piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly parents). 

Patience has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Patience sells her products in a shop, retail. Patience has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Patience include increasing prices of clothes   and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also buy a plot of land and build her own house.

Patience lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 49 years old, married to Regina, and they have three children. He has been practicing farming for the last 10 years. He plants various cash crops like maize and beans as well as potatoes.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer for planting during this planting season. He also plans to buy herbicides for his crops.

In the future, Simon hopes to invest more in his farming, make more income and thereby buy farm machinery.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grain to grind into various products

loans.name: Gervas

texts.en:
Gervas is a twenty-nine-year-old man who is married with three children. He has a motorcycle transport business. He has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of four thousand shillings.


This will be his first loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. In future he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Madame Dédé est mère de 01 enfant scolarisé qui a 12ans. Son conjoint est maçon carreleur. Dédé âgée de 43ans est revendeuse de yaourt, jus, eaux et divers dans une boutique. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et est aidée par 02 personnes. Elle a démarré son activité en 2002 et n’éprouve pas de d’énormes difficultés dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut dans l’avenir augmenter son capital et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dédé, age 43, is a mother to a 12-year-old child who goes to school. Her spouse is a mason and tile setter. She sells yogurt, juice, waters and various other products, an activity started in 2002. She conducts her business out of a shop with two helpers, and she buys her stock in Lomé. She is not facing any major obstacles in her activity. 

She is seeking a second loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. She wants to increase her working capital and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for juice, some water, and various other items for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 38 years old and married with 3 children. He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, a 50-year-old single man with seven children ranging from 16 to 25 years of age, describes himself as dedicated and goal-oriented. He has been operating a retail store selling paints for 22 years and employs five staff members. His business is located in a busy environment conducive to business, and his primary customers are local residents.

Describing his biggest business challenge to be delays in customer payments, James is requesting this Kes 20,000 loan to purchase titanium dioxide and paint stains. His business goal is to be a large supplier of paint.

loans.use: to purchase titanium dioxide and stain.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce  is divorced with five children, and three of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her grandsons).   She has a business selling used clothes and sells these clothes at mobile markets and on a retail basis. She has been in this business for one year and sells to all categories of people.

Joyce has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works five days a week.  Her major business challenges are the  transportation of bales from one market to another and increasing prices of clothes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and getting permanent business premises and also starting selling wholesale only. 

Joyce lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is married with children, and he has a salon and a cereals shop, in Kiambu.  He has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of sixteen thousand shillings.


This will be his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase more hair products and accessories. With the profits he would like to purchase more cereals. 

In future he wants to expand his business to another  town.

loans.use: to purchase more hair products and accessories

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “KUÑA GUAPA” está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Asunción. Todas las integrantes del comité se esfuerzan día a día para el bienestar de sus familias, para que estas tengan un futuro mejor y distinto del que a ellas tocó vivir. 
Guillermina es parte del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de Carbón, en lo que le está yendo muy bien, ya que últimamente el carbón se compra mucho, pues el gas tiene un costo muy elevado. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo para poder seguir dando a su familia lo que necesitan. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá seguir teniendo su producto en stock y no quedarse sin abasto del mismo. Ellas agradecen la oportunidad que están recibiendo de la fundación y de kiva.
texts.en:
The committee named "Kuña Guapa" consists of 17 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors from the city of Asunción. All of these committee members strive day after day to provide for the welfare of their families so that they can have a better future and a life that is different from what they experienced.

Guillermina is a member of this group. She says that she sells charcoal and has done very well in this business. Lately she has bought a lot of charcoal since the price of gas is very high. Her goal is to continue growing so that she can provide what her family needs. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy charcoal so that she will have enough product in stock and avoid being depleted. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Brdget

texts.en:
Bridget is married and has two children. She has a dairy farm in Ndumberi and has been in this business for two years.  She earns a monthly income of 10,000 shillings. 

Bridget is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to to purchase dairy feeds for her cow. With the profits, she plans to increase the number of cows she owns.   In the future, she wants to venture into poultry farming so as to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds for her cow.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a twenty-four-year-old married woman. She has a green grocery shop  and has been in the business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 


This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for her business. 


In future she wants to expand her business and improve her family’s welfare

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her green grocery business.

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es: Yrene es socia del Bancomunal Urpicha II, tiene 40 años de edad,es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año, es divorciada, gracias a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal está progresando en su negocio y también le ayudan con la educación de sus hijos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como leche, azúcar, aceite, arroz, fideos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yrene is a member of the Communal Bank "Urpicha II". She is 40 years old and the owner of a grocery store. Yrene is divorced and the mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year. Thanks to the training classes offered by her Communal Bank, Yrene has been able to make progress in her business and also help her children with their education.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as milk, sugar, oil, and noodles for her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a cosmetics shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 9 years and has employed 2 people. To earn extra income she runs a cafeteria. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 90,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cosmetics and body lotions to sell.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and body lotions to sell

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a 48-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the butcher business for ten years. His hardship is high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to diversify his business. Gideon wants a loan to buy goats for sale in his shop.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Ma. Liz

texts.en: This time, Ma. Liz is borrowing Php 38,000 to fund her general store and bakery. The general store and fish vending business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continue to provide Ma. Liz and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell  in her general store and ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Stefany

texts.es: Stefany es socia del Bancomunal Urpicha II, tiene 38 años de edad, Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años, ella aprendió a ahorrar, a administrar su dinero,a economizar y a ser más responsable, agradece todo el apoyo que le dieron en su Bancomunal en los momentos en que mas lo necesitaba.Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas como gaseosas,refrescos,jugos para su negocio.
texts.en:
38-year old Stefany is a member of the Urpicha II Community Bank; she has also been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. She has learned how to save money, how to look after her money, to budget, and to be more responsible. She is grateful for all the support she has received from her Bank at the time she most needed it.

Now Stefany is seeking a loan to buy drinks such as pop, soft drinks, and juice for her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as pop, soft drinks, and juice

loans.name: Berlen Gabriela

texts.es: Berlen Gabriela es una emprendedora exitosa que toda la vida ha luchado por salir adelante, esta emprendedora es una clienta activa de Fundación León 2000, durante los ciclos que ha venido trabajando ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación, actualmente esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para la pulpería como granos básicos, pan, galletas, verduras, detergentes entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Berlen Gabriela is a successful entrepreneur who has spent her entire life striving to move forward. She is an active client of Fundación León 2000. In all of the loan cycles in which she has participated, Berlen has demonstrated that she is a responsible individual who desires to succeed.

She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy products for her store such as basic grains, bread, cookies, vegetables, detergents, and other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, cookies, vegetables, detergents, and other products.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 43-year-old man who is married with three children. He has a printing and photocopying services business in Nairobi Central Business District. He has been in the business for 11 years now, and has a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This will be his third loan with KADET. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase a printing machine. In the future he wants to be the best seller of printing and photocopying machines.

loans.use: to purchase a printing machine.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas mobiliario para su negocio, ella se dedica a la renta de mesas y sillas para eventos sociales.
Ella es una madre de familia sola para lo cual el negocio que tiene es para sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarle la mejor educacion es por eso que acude con nosotros para que la apoyemos.
texts.en: Sra. Ana Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy more furnishings for her business.  She rents out tables and chairs for social events.  Ana Maria is a mother whose business is her only means of helping her children move forward and providing them a better education.  It is for this reason that a request is being made for Kiva's support.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and is married to Mary. They have one child who is two years old.

Peter has a motorbike business that he has been doing for the past five years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD, to enable him to buy another motorcycle.

He hopes to be able to build residential houses in the near future.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Roshellane

texts.en:
Roshellane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a "trisikad" transport business in the Philippines.

Roshellane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional "trisikad" transport vehicle.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Roshellane would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional "trisikad" transport vehicle.

loans.name: Sinfrosa

texts.en:
Sinfrosa is 72 years old and married with 2 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sinfrosa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed, vitamins and other needs for her pigs.

Sinfrosa has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed, vitamins and other needs for her pigs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane  is married and has seven children, three of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members.
